entries: The Guild Wars franchise is the flagship franchise of the Washington state based development studio ArenaNet.
If first entry into it's now 20 year old story is Guild Wars Prophecies, as it was later known.
This book aims to capture the story and the feelings of this beloved game, and bring them to the gaming table with the help of the Dungeons & Dragons 5th edition rule set.
All credit goes to the amazing people at ArenaNet and NCSoft, who have given us players such magical adventures.

entries.name: Introduction
entries: Introduction into the story.

entries.name: Ascalon City
entries: Ascalon City

entries.name: Barradin Estate
entries: Barradin Estate

items: {@i {@b An adventure for Level 2 characters.}}
{@i This adventure is designed to fill two or three sessions of play.}

entries.name: Key Plot Points
entries: The following information is key to the adventure's story:

items.name: Tunnel in the Making
items.entry: The {@race Charr|GW} and {@race Grawl|GW} forces under {@creature Vatlaaw Doomtooth|GWP} have constructed a tunnel from Piken Square into the Catacombs. This tunnel undermines the Great Northern Wall and was used to bring a Searing Cauldron south of it. Clues near the southern entrance of the Catacombs—and within—can reveal pieces of this plan to the characters.

items.name: Place of Worship
items.entry: The Catacombs are a place of worship; followers of {@deity Grenth|Human Gods|GW} and his priests regularly brave the dangers below to visit his shrine. A second sect has recently begun using the Catacombs: devotees of {@deity Abaddon|Human Gods|GW} have claimed an ancient ritual chamber and perform forbidden rites to commune with the fallen god. The characters must navigate both holy sites to find the tunnel entrance.

items.name: Spurned Lover
items.entry: The tunnel breaches the deepest vault, the Screamheart Crypt, where a {@creature Screamheart|GWP} has taken residence. Once a necromancer, she lost herself entirely to dark arts in a desperate bid to prove her former lover {@creature Eve|GW} wrong.

entries.name: Preparation
entries: Before running the adventure, prepare as follows:

items.name: Step 1
items.entry: Read the {@area Recommended Proficiencies and Spells|GWP3c3|x} section.

items.name: Step 3
items.entry: Familiarize yourself with the Key NPCs table below; the characters will interact with these individuals throughout the adventure.

items: {@creature Bone Horror|GW}
{@creature Crypt Fiend|GWP}
{@creature Deadly Crypt Spider|GWP}
{@creature Raging Cadaver|GWP}
{@creature Restless Corpse|GWP}
{@creature Restless Armor|GWP}
{@creature Screamheart|GWP}
{@creature Shatter Gargoyle|GWP}
{@creature Skullreaver|GWP}
{@creature Tomb Nightmare|GWP}

entries.caption: Key NPCs
rows: Not in the Catacombs, but clues to his plan can be found in the Catacombs

entries.name: Recommended Proficiencies and Spells
entries: You can run this adventure for any number of Level 2 characters. Ideally, the party should include proficiency in at least two of the following skills:

items: {@skill Arcana}
{@skill Atheletics}
{@skill Investigation}
{@skill Perception}
{@skill Religion}

entries: Access to the following spells is also helpful:

items: {@spell detect magic|xphb}
{@spell feather fall|xphb}
{@spell knock|xphb}

entries.name: Adventure Background
entries: Among the oldest structures in Ascalon, the Catacombs are a sprawling network of tombs, tunnels, and caverns. They shelter undead, subterranean wildlife, and the occasional desperate fugitive. The passages run beneath much of Ascalon, linking distant places through forgotten ways; no one truly knows how many entrances exist. Recently, the {@race Charr|GW} began using the Catacombs to infiltrate lands south of the Great Northern Wall.

entries.name: Maria Iceheart
entries: Maria met {@creature Eve|GW} during her time at the Holy Dwayna Academy for Wayward & Incorrigible Girls (Ascalon City branch). United by a shared fascination with necromancy, friendship quickly became romance—even after Eve was expelled. In the years before the {@race Charr|GW} assault, the two met often to trade techniques and simply to belong; both were young women pushed to the margins for their interests. After the attack, Maria’s studies turned increasingly vile. Believing the {@race Charr|GW} had a right to reclaim their homeland—and that the scorned should aid the scorned—she embraced darker rites. {@creature Eve|GW}, by then traveling with {@creature Devona|GW} and her companions, tried to pull Maria back. Seeing this as betrayal, Maria fled into the Catacombs to continue her experiments.

There she contacted an unknown patron—unbeknownst to her, the fallen god {@deity Abaddon|GW}. Power answered, at the cost of her mortal form; Maria became a {@creature Banshee|XMM}. She made the Catacombs her home and was among the first to notice the excavation. Realizing the tunnel’s purpose, she moved to the {@area Screamheart Crypt|GWP3c6h|x} to guard the breach.

entries.name: Vatlaaw Doomtooth
entries: {@creature Vatlaaw Doomtooth|GWP}, a Blood Legion centurion and strategist of the Searing, concluded that the Searing Cauldrons’ full devastation required one to be placed south of the Wall. His solution was a covert link from Piken Square—once a human settlement, now a {@race Charr|GW} outpost—into the Catacombs, then ferrying a Cauldron through the underways to the mountains overlooking Ascalon City.

To mask the work, he manipulated local grawl and bandits: the grawl were promised a powerful god, while human royalists received weapons to attempt an uprising against King Adelbern. Doomtooth has since left the Catacombs to prepare for the Searing, but following the tunnel all the way to Piken Square may reveal traces of his plan.

entries.name: Eve
entries: From The Guild Wars Factions Manuscripts:

{@i "Eve hasn't a clue where she was born—she was found as a young child stealing food from a sleeping vagrant in the back alleys of Ascalon City. Fortunately for Eve, she was not found by a city guard but by a kindly matron, who brought her to the Holy Dwayna Academy for Wayward & Incorrigible Girls (Ascalon City branch). Wherever Eve had come from, she had already learned to read at an advanced level before she ended up at the school students called the "Wayward Academy," and voraciously devoured every text in the library. It wasn't long before Eve's curiosity (and her ability to both manipulate and avoid Matron Irma) led her to a secret library in the bowels of the Academy. There, forbidden texts opened up an entirely new world to young Eve. By the time she was 15, she had raised her first bone minion.}

{@i "Eve had never gotten along with the other girls—she much preferred the company of her tomes and scrolls. When, one day, a few of her fellow students pulled an especially vicious and humiliating prank on her, Eve literally pounced upon the leader of her tormentors, bit the girl’s ear off, and swallowed it whole. That was the end of Eve’s studies at the Holy Dwayna Academy for Wayward & Incorrigible Girls, and not even Matron Irma mourned her departure.}

{@i "Eve met Mhenlo, Cynn, Devona, and Aidan during the Charr invasion. She was in the graveyard, experimenting with new methods of undead resurrection, when the Charr flooded into the cemetery on the heels of Mhenlo and the others. More out of curiosity than any noble intentions, Eve ordered the Charr to stop. When the beastly creatures turned on her instead, thinking her easy prey, she simply raised her hands and called forth a small army of the dead to meet them. The Charr never stood a chance. Eve was amused when Devona asked the Necromancer to join them, but has since become a good friend of Devona, Aidan, and Mhenlo. She is often in conflict with Cynn, but the two respect each other’s power enough to get along when the going gets rough."}

entries.name: Entering the Catacombs
entries: To enter the Catacombs, the characters must light all the soul torches that ward the gate. Once lit, the gate swings open with a groan. A soul torch can be kindled either by transferring flame from a torch that already burns (the magic exacts a necrotic toll) or by smearing the blood of a freshly slain creature upon it.

Beyond the gate, a tunnel descends into the earth. After a few minutes, the path splits: the left branch climbs slightly toward a faint, distant glow and becomes less worked and more natural, leading to {@area CA2: Entangling Fall|GWP3c6b|x}; the right branch remains level, fully man-made, and completely dark, leading to {@area CA1: Corridor of Sleeping Armors|GWP3c6a|x}.

entries.name: CA1: Corridor of Sleeping Armors

entries: The corridor stretches ahead, lined with six suits of armor standing motionless against the wall. Opposite each suit, a torch burns brightly in an iron sconce. Two of the suits appear squat and broad, crafted in the proportions of dwarves.
There are six suits of {@creature Restless Armor|GWP} (see Addendum: Monsters). Each armor is positioned directly across from a lit torch.

entries.name: Trigger
entries: If a creature passes in front of an armor while its opposing torch is lit, that armor animates and attacks.

entries.name: Avoidance
entries: Extinguishing the torch prevents it from animating.

entries.name: Variation
entries: The second and fourth armors are dwarf-sized but otherwise function identically to the others.

entries.name: Tactics
entries: The armors fight until destroyed. However, if the torch opposite an armor is extinguished while it is active, that armor becomes inert again and does not reactivate unless the torch is relit.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Four suits can be used as {@item Plate Armor|XPHB} for Medium creatures; two are sized for dwarves. They are old and rusty but functional; each sells for 100 gp.

items: {@b To {@area Entering the Catacombs|GWP3c5|x}.} A straight, torch-lit hall of worked stone returns to the entrance area; its walls are lined with empty brackets and scuffed floor marks where armor stands once sat (~10 minutes).

{@b To {@area CA3: Yawning Darkness|GWP3c6c|x}.} A narrow corridor dotted with alcoves and abandoned torch stubs slopes gently upward to the pit chamber; the air grows colder with each step (~10 minutes).

entries.name: CA2: Entangling Fall

entries: A thin waterfall spills into this cavern, its spray leaving the stone floor slick with moisture. At the base of the fall, a dark pool churns before spreading across the cavern floor. Thick spiderwebs cling to the lower walls and stretch across much of the chamber, glistening in the dim light.
The cavern is 20 feet deep, with a waterfall flowing into a pool at its center.

entries.name: Waterfall
entries: Traversing the waterfall requires a successful {@dc 10} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. On a failure, the creature is swept into the pool below.

entries.name: Spiderwebs
entries: The lower portion of the cave is covered in sticky webs. A creature that falls or steps into the webs becomes {@condition restrained}. Escaping the webs requires a successful {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. The webs can also be attacked (AC 13, 10 hit points, vulnerability to fire; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic).

entries.name: Alert
entries: A disturbance in the webs alerts the {@creature Deadly Crypt Spider|GWP|Deadly Crypt Spiders} lurking nearby (see Addendum: Monsters).

entries.name: Pool
entries: The pool is difficult terrain. Climbing out of it requires stepping directly into the spiderwebs.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: In the webs are the following creatures:

entries.caption: Creatures
rows: Alternating 1 or 2 {@creature Deadly Crypt Spider|GWP|Deadly Crypt Spiders} (2 for odd N, 1 for even N)
Hidden somewhere in the webs; roll a {@skill Stealth} check for each spider. If the result exceeds a character’s passive Perception, that spider is hidden from that character.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Covered in webs are the corpses of two grawl carrying the following items:

entries.caption: Treasure
rows: On the body of a half-digested grawl
On the body of a half-digested grawl
Covered in webs at the bottom pit

items: {@b To {@area Entering the Catacombs|GWP3c5|x}.} A root-choked natural tunnel winds back toward the entry; humidity fades and the floor turns from mud to worked stone near the end (~10 minutes).
{@b To {@area CA3: Yawning Darkness|GWP3c6c|x}.} A damp passage where webs thin to wisps rises toward the worked-stone galleries around the pit; faint chittering echoes behind you (~10 minutes).

entries.name: CA3: Yawning Darkness

entries: The chamber opens around a vast, square pit that yawns in the center of the floor. The bottom is shrouded in impenetrable blackness, a darkness that even darkvision cannot pierce. Cold air seeps upward from the void, carrying with it the faintest whispers of anguish.

A {@creature repentant cultist|GWP} (see Addendum: Monsters) hovers invisibly in the center of the chamber. It attacks once all creatures have entered, using telekinesis to shove intruders into the pit.

entries.name: The Pit
entries: The pit is 20 feet deep and filled with magical darkness. This darkness can’t be dispelled by magic, but fades if a character prays to the statue of Grenth (located in {@area CA5: Lord of Death's Chamber|GWP3c6e|x}) or defeats the {@creature Tomb Nightmare|GWP} (located in {@area CA7: A Misguided Attempt at Greatness|GWP3c6g|x}). Doing so also causes the secret door at the pit’s base to open.

entries.name: Secret Door
entries: At the bottom of the pit is a hidden passage leading down into the {@area CA8: Screamheart Crypt|GWP3c6h|x}. Discovering the door requires a successful {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. It can be opened with a {@dc 25} Dexterity check using {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, or by praying to the statue of Grenth (in {@area CA5: Lord of Death's Chamber|GWP3c6e|x}) or by defeating the {@creature Tomb Nightmare|GWP} (in {@area CA7: A Misguided Attempt at Greatness|GWP3c6g|x}).

entries.name: Hazard
entries: Any creature shoved or falling into the pit takes normal falling damage ({@damage 2d6} bludgeoning).

entries.name: Treasure
entries: In the pit are the following items:

entries.caption: Treasure
rows: On the body of a cultist at the bottom of the pit

items: {@b To {@area CA1: Corridor of Sleeping Armors|GWP3c6a|x}.} A straight gallery of squared stone and repeating torch niches leads back toward the mustering corridor (~10 minutes).
{@b To {@area CA2: Entangling Fall|GWP3c6b|x}.} A moisture-slick tunnel where thin strands of web cling to the ceiling slopes down to the waterfall cavern (~10 minutes).
{@b To {@area CA4: Howling Crossing|GWP3c6d|x}.} A wind-gnawed passage strewn with gravel ascends toward the chasm bridge; distant howls ride the draft (~10 minutes).
{@b To {@area CA6: The Final Resting Place|GWP3c6f|x}.} A cracked stair and toppled plinths trail down into coffin-lined halls reeking of stale dust (~10 minutes).

{@b Hidden to {@area CA8: Screamheart Crypt|GWP3c6h|x}.} A secret door at the pit’s base reveals a tight spiral stair and bone-lined ossuary passage (see the Secret Door in this area); the descent takes roughly 10 minutes.

entries.name: CA4: Howling Crossing

entries: A narrow stone bridge spans the cavern, its surface slick with damp mist. Bitter winds howl through the chasm, tugging at cloaks and threatening to unbalance even the surest footing. Wisps of pale figures drift across the bridge, their hollow moans echoing against the stone. Far below, shapes crawl and writhe, clawing at the walls as though desperate to escape the pit.

Crossing the bridge is treacherous due to powerful winds and ghostly disturbances. Each creature attempting to cross rolls two d20s: one for the first half of the bridge and one for the second half. Consult the Howling Crossing Events table for the results.

entries.name: The Pit
entries: The ravine below is 30 feet deep. A creature that falls takes only half normal falling damage, cushioned by the writhing, half-dead things below, but suffers {@damage 1d4} slashing damage at the start of each of its turns while in the pit.

entries.name: Crossing
entries: If forced off the bridge, a creature falls unless it has a method of flight, clinging, or teleportation.

entries.caption: Howling Crossing Events
rows: A violent gust threatens to hurl the creature from the bridge. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed off.
Ghostly figures lunge at the creature, attempting to terrify it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be forced to move off the bridge.
A heavy gust of wind presses against the creature. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed off.
A gust pushes the creature back. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be pushed one section backward.
A sudden upward draft lifts the creature from the surface. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or be lifted 20 feet into the air before falling.
A section of the bridge crumbles beneath the creature’s feet. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or fall.
A bitter chill seeps into the creature’s bones. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be forced to roll one additional event die.
Loose rocks tumble from the cavern ceiling. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Tactics
entries: The winds and ghosts affect only creatures actively crossing the bridge. Ghostly figures vanish immediately after their assault. The crawling things below attack any creature that falls into the pit until it escapes.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Scattered at the bottom of the ravine are the remains of past victims. Searching them reveals:

entries.caption: Treasure
rows: In the grasp of a skeletal hand at the bottom of the pit

items: {@b To {@area CA3: Yawning Darkness|GWP3c6c|x}.} A rough-cut ramp descends to the square pit chamber; grit and dust swirl in eddies along the floor (~10 minutes).
{@b To {@area CA5: Lord of Death's Chamber|GWP3c6e|x}.} An arched nave hewn from pale stone rises toward frost-rimmed statuary and the looming effigy of Grenth (~10 minutes).

entries: Four jagged stone spires rise from the cavern floor, each crowned by a crouching gargoyle. Against the far wall looms a massive statue of a hooded figure, its stone eyes fixed on the chamber. Mist swirls at the statue’s feet, frost gathering on the surfaces close to it. The air is still, as if waiting.

entries.name: Gargoyles
entries: The four gargoyles remain motionless until the inscription on the Statue of Grenth is read aloud. At that moment, they animate and attack. One gargoyle joins the fight each round, swooping down from its perch, until N are active.

entries.name: The Inscription
entries: Reading the carved words aloud in any language opens the passage in the {@area CA3: Yawning Darkness|GWP3c6c|x}. The inscription reads:
"{@italic Came then Desmina, scorned and exiled by her people. And in her misery and wretchedness, did Desmina curse the gods for abandoning all who, like her, admired power and ambition.}
{@italic And asketh she, "Where is the god to whom I may give my undying devotion? Where is the god to whom I may beg revenge against those who scorn me?"}

{@italic And rumbled then the earth from far below, and with a terrible groan, split open. The ground grew white with frost and ice, and from forth the frozen earth spilled the rotted, skeletal minions of Grenth.}

{@italic Appeared then the god, and with bony hands outstretched, welcomed the girl into His fold. Saith he, "I am your god. Follow where I lead, come whence I call, and the rotted corpses of the dead will be yours to control." And swearing allegiance in life and beyond, did Desmina thence become the god's first follower.}
{@italic — Scriptures of Grenth, 48 BE"}
The inscription is written in Ascalonian but can be read in any language.

Reading it also sends the mist gathering at the statue's feet out of the room, rushing back through the passage to the {@area CA3: Yawning Darkness|GWP3c6c|x} and dispelling the magical darkness there, disabling any chambers along the way.

entries.name: Hidden Trapdoor
entries: Behind the statue is a concealed trapdoor. Finding it requires a {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) or Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check. Opening it requires a {@dc 15} Dexterity check using {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}. It is trapped with a glyph that triggers when the door is opened, dealing {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage to each creature within 10 feet. The trap can be disarmed with a successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check or a {@dc 15} Dexterity check using {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}.

entries.name: Tactics
entries: The gargoyles use their flight and high perches to dive, strike, and retreat. Each round, a new gargoyle joins the fight until N are active. They focus on characters near the statue first to prevent interference with the inscription or trapdoor.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: Perched atop the stone arches are the following creatures:

entries.caption: Creatures
rows: Perched atop one of the stone arches

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The treasure room contains the following items:

entries.caption: Treasure
rows: If not already found in {@area CA6: The Final Resting Place|GWP3c6f|x}, in a chest in the back of the room
In a chest in the back of the room
In a chest in the back of the room
If not already found in {@area CA6: The Final Resting Place|GWP3c6f|x}, in a chest in the back of the room

entries.name: Advancement
entries: If the party is not level 3 or higher, they gain enough experience to reach level 3 after completing this area.

items: {@b To {@area CA4: Howling Crossing|GWP3c6d|x}.} A processional aisle flanked by cracked gargoyles slopes back toward the roaring chasm; a thin rime of frost lingers on the flagstones (~10 minutes).
{@b To {@area Treasure (CA5)|GWP3c6e1f|x}.} A concealed trapdoor behind the statue drops to a cramped vault via iron rungs and a narrow crawl (see Hidden Trapdoor in this area; ~10 minutes).

entries: The heavy stone door slams shut behind you with a resonant thud. Faint arcane runes flare briefly across its surface before fading into stillness. Lining the walls and placed around the chamber are rows of ancient stone coffins, their lids carved with worn reliefs of long-forgotten figures. Another door waits on the far side of the chamber, its surface etched with the same arcane sigils. The air is thick with dust — and something else… expectation.

entries.name: Arcane Lock
entries: Both the entrance and exit doors are sealed with {@spell arcane lock|xphb}. Without the matching key, a door can be forced with a {@dc 25} Strength check or opened by dispelling the effect (such as with {@spell dispel magic|xphb}).

entries.name: Keys to Escape
entries: A secret exit leads to a hidden treasure chamber where a key can be found. The secret door can be found with a {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) or Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

Alternatively, one coffin contains a key. Opening the correct coffin grants the key that unlocks both doors. Once the key is used, it mystically returns to its resting place, allowing reuse if the party returns.

entries.name: Coffins
entries: Most are empty, but some contain creatures. The first time a coffin holding a creature is opened, the opener is {@condition surprised}. Once active, these creatures attempt to break open other coffins containing their kind, potentially escalating the encounter.
Before opening, one character may attempt an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern if a creature is inside. The DC equals 10 + the creature’s CR.

entries.name: Tactics
entries: The first awakened creature immediately attacks. On its turn, if not engaged, it attempts to open another coffin of its kind. The encounter difficulty quickly increases if the party allows multiple coffins to be opened.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: Inside are the following creatures:

entries.caption: Creatures
rows: Randomly in one of the coffins
Randomly in one of the coffins
Randomly in one of the coffins
In the coffin in front of the secret exit
Randomly in one of the coffins

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The treasure room contains the following items:

entries.caption: Treasure
rows: If not already found in {@area CA5: Lord of Death's Chamber|GWP3c6e|x}, in a chest in the back of the room
In a chest in the back of the room
In a chest in the back of the room
If not already found in {@area CA5: Lord of Death's Chamber|GWP3c6e|x}, in a chest in the back of the room

items: {@b To {@area CA7: A Misguided Attempt at Greatness|GWP3c6g|x}.} Blackened candle stubs and chalked sigils mark a winding hall that opens into the circular ritual chamber (~10 minutes).
{@b To {@area CA3: Yawning Darkness|GWP3c6c|x}.} A side corridor narrows into oppressive silence as the abyssal pit draws near; the air grows noticeably colder (~10 minutes).
{@b To {@area Treasure (CA6)|GWP3c6f1f|x}.} A hairline seam in the masonry (see Keys to Escape) conceals a short, low passage to the hidden treasure room (~10 minutes).

entries.name: CA7: A Misguided Attempt at Greatness

entries: A broad stone slab dominates the chamber, ringed by guttering candles and chalked runes. A shallow bowl sits at the altar’s center, filled with a black liquid that ripples without wind.

entries.name: Altar of Abaddon
entries: This altar is dedicated to {@deity Abaddon|Human Gods|GW}, the god of secrets and forbidden knowledge. It is a place of dark rituals and summoning. The altar is a 5-foot-high stone slab with a shallow bowl carved into its center, filled with a restless black liquid. The floor is inscribed with Orrian runes that spell out the name of Abaddon. The candles around the altar are part of a containment ritual designed to keep summoned entities at bay while they burn.

entries.name: Extinguishing Candles & Summoning
entries: When any creature first comes within 10 feet of the altar, the candles wink out one by one over a heartbeat. Once all are dark, the area is primed. Any creature that then interacts with the altar or the bowl must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. Then, a {@creature Tomb Nightmare|GWP} tears free of the altar’s shadow and appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. As the demon manifests, magical darkness floods the chamber as if affected by {@spell darkness|xphb}: nonmagical light can’t illuminate the area, and magical light of 2nd level or lower is suppressed. This darkness ends when the Tomb Nightmare is defeated or the bowl is spilled (see below).

entries.name: The Bowl of Black Liquid
entries: After the demon appears, a creature that interacts with the bowl must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the creature can clearly perceive the Tomb Nightmare even while it hides or melds with shadow, and it has advantage on attack rolls against the demon for the rest of the encounter. On a failure, the creature is {@condition frightened} of the demon until the end of its next turn. Knocking over the bowl or scattering its contents (action) forces the demon’s essence to recoil: the Tomb Nightmare immediately loses half of its current hit points. The chamber’s darkness ends, the candles flare back to steady light, and normal illumination can return.

entries.name: Clues & Checks
entries: A creature that can read Orrian or uses magic to comprehend writing learns the runes invoke {@deity Abaddon|Human Gods|GW} and bind a nightmare to the altar. A {@dc 13} Intelligence ({@skill Arcana} or {@skill Religion}) check identifies the candles as a containment ward designed to keep a summoned entity at bay while they burn.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: In the room are the following creatures:

entries.caption: Creatures
rows: 1 {@creature Tomb Nightmare|GWP}; it can use Animate Bone Horror to summon {@creature Bone Horror|GW|Bone Horrors} even if there are no corpses

entries.name: Treasure
entries: After defeating the demon, it leaves behind the following items:

entries.name: Advancement
entries: If the party is not level 3 or higher, they gain enough experience to reach level 3 after completing this area.

items: {@b To {@area CA6: The Final Resting Place|GWP3c6f|x}.} A somber hall of dark stone bears scraped rune-work and pools of old wax; distant whispers seem to follow travelers back toward the coffins (~10 minutes).

entries: The passage opens into a vaulted crypt of cold stone. Two long strips of glass run the length of the floor, etched with intricate sigils and scenes of noble funerary rites. Beneath the panes, shapes churn slowly—half-formed bodies pressing against the glass from below. Hovering at the chamber’s heart is a spectral woman, her jaw unhinging wider than human as a strangled breath gathers in her throat. Below her sprawled on the floor is a pale woman with white hair, unconscious.

entries.name: Glass Floor
entries: Two parallel glass strips (each 5 feet wide) span the chamber. They are fragile but warded. A creature can attempt to break a 5-foot section of glass with a {@dc 15} Strength check as an action. The glass also shatters when the {@creature Screamheart|GWP} uses its Scream ability.

entries.name: Broken Glass & Rising Dead
entries: If a section of glass is broken, N {@creature Raging Cadaver|GWP} clamber out of the pit beneath at the start of the next round, and every other round thereafter. The DM may split these spawns between the two glass strips as appropriate.

entries.name: Falling into the Pits
entries: A creature that falls through the glass drops 15 feet, taking {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage. While in the pit, the writhing half-formed corpses batter intruders: the creature takes {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns until it escapes. Climbing out of the pit requires a {@dc 12} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check due to the slick, shifting masses. The pit walls count as difficult terrain.

entries.name: Eve
entries: The unconscious woman on the floor is {@creature Eve|GWP}. She tried to confront the Screamheart herself, after hearing of her. Maria is keeping her alive with her magic, to wake her up the Screamheart must be defeated.

entries.name: Stalking Shadows
entries: At the start of the second round of combat, and at the start of every other round thereafter, the Screamheart uses its Stalking Shadows ability. This causes the shadows in the room to come alive, roll {@dice 1d4} to determine from which sarcophagus the shadows emerge. The {@creature creeping shadows|GWP} start moving towrds {@creature Eve|GWP} and reach her at the start of the next round. If the shadows reach her, they cause her to gain one failed death save. If she has three failed death saves, she dies. The shadows can be attacked, and if they are defeated, they do not reach her. To defeat a shadow, it must either be exposed to bright light, or it must take radiant damage.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: In the room are the following creatures:

entries.caption: Creatures
rows: Hovering in the middle of the room
Emerging from one of the sarcophagi each round after the first
Clambering out of the glass pits

entries.name: Treasure
entries: After defeating the Screamheart, it leaves behind the following items:

entries.name: Advancement
entries: If the party is not level 4 or higher, they gain enough experience to reach level 4 after completing this area.

items: {@b To {@area CA3: Yawning Darkness|GWP3c6c|x}.} A bone-niche spiral climbs through stale, breathless air to the hidden door at the base of the pit (see CA3’s Secret Door; ~10 minutes).

entries.name: Conclusion
entries: Having defeated the {@creature Screamheart|GWP} Eve wakes up if she survived and they are free to explore the crypt. If she survived, she explains everything she knows about the Screamheart, and asks what the party is doing here. If the party explains that they are looking for a tunnel, she tells them that she has heard of a tunnel that was built by the royalists, but she does not know where it is. She then offers to contact Rurik from them and inform him about the tunnel.

Investigating the crypt they find mining equipment and correspondence from a high ranking member of the royalists, detailing the construction of a tunnel connecting the crypt to Piken Square. The other person of the correspondence is a unkown person, only signing as 'V.D.'. They demand the tunnel to be large enough for a wagon to pass through, and that it must be finished quickly. Shortly after construction started, it became clear that the tunnel would not be finished in time, and the royalist demanded that the tunnel be made smaller. In response, 'V.D.' sent them an item that would help them finish the tunnel faster, a {@item Sphere of Annihilation|XDMG}. The royalist were horrified by the item, but 'V.D.' assured them that it was safe to use, as long as they followed the instructions laid out by the provider of the item, a person named 'Terick'. The first correspondence is dated a few days after the initial attack on Ascalon. The last one is dated 2 weeks ago.

Followin the instructions of the correspondence, the party can find a secret door leading to the tunnel. The tunnel leads to the Piken Square. The tunnel is about 250 km long. The chapter {@area Piken Sqaure|GWP3d|x} expands on the travel through the tunnel and what can be found there.

items: {@i {@b An adventure for Level 4 characters.}}
{@i This adventure is designed to fill one or two sessions of play.}

entries.name: Key Plot Points
entries: The following information is key to the adventure's story:

entries.name: Preparation
entries: Before running the adventure, prepare as follows:

items.name: Step 1
items.entry: Read the {@area Recommended Proficiencies and Spells|GWP3d3|x} section.

items.name: Step 3
items.entry: Familiarize yourself with the Key NPCs table below; the characters will interact with these individuals throughout the adventure.

items: {@creature Charr Hunter|GWP}
{@creature Aidan|GW}

entries.caption: Key NPCs
rows: Not in Piken Square, but remnants of his plan can be found in the Piken Square

entries.name: Recommended Proficiencies and Spells
entries: You can run this adventure for any number of Level 4 characters. Ideally, the party should include proficiency in at least two of the following skills:

items: {@skill Arcana}

entries: Access to the following spells is also helpful:

items: {@spell detect magic|xphb}

entries.name: Travel to Piken Square
entries: Reaching Piken Square from the tunnel takes about 7 days on foot.

entries.name: Screamheart Crypt → Piken Square (Tunnel)
entries: {@b Distance.} 250 km; {@b Terrain.} magically carve tunnel with pockets of danger; {@b Travel Pace.} fast 5 days; normal 7 days; slow 11 days.

entries.name: Resting Place
entries: Around 250 meters into the tunnel, the party comes across a small alcove carved into the wall. Inside are the remains of a camp, long abandoned. A few rusted tools and a tattered journal remain. The journal belonged to a miner who worked on the tunnel, and it details the hardships they faced, including cave-ins and attacks by strange creatures. The last entry is dated two weeks ago, and it mentions that they were close to finishing the tunnel when they were forced to abandon it due to an attack by unknown assailants. Similar camps can be found every 3000 meters or so. After the change of style, the camps become cleanly carved and no longer have tools or journals.

entries.name: Change of Style
entries: Around 500 meters into the tunnel, the rough-hewn walls and floor suddenly shift to a magically carved style. Any character who takes the {@action Study|XPHP} action to inspect the change and succeeds on a {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) check learns that the change was made using a powerful magical artifact, likely a {@item Sphere of Annihilation|XDMG}. From this point on, the tunnel is smooth.

entries.name: Rushing Rapids
entries: Around 50 km into the tunnel, the party comes across a section of the tunnel that crosses a subterranean river. The river is fast-moving and treacherous, with strong currents and hidden rocks. The bridge that once crossed the river has been collapsed, and the party must find a way to cross. The river about 35 feet wide and 10 feet below the tunnel floor. The party can attempt to swim across, but they must make a {@dc 15} Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check to avoid being swept away by the current. A creature that fails the check is swept 50 feet downstream and takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage from rocks and debris and can make another check at the end of each of its turns to try to reach the shore.

entries.name: Devourers in the Dark
entries: Around 175 km into the tunnel, the party is ambushed by a group of N {@creature Lash Devourer|GWP} and N-2 {@creature Carrion Devourer|GWP}. The devourers have made their home in one of the pockets of the tunnel, and they attack anyone who enters their territory. They are feasting on the remains of the miners who were forced to abandon the tunnel. Any character who takes the {@action Study|XPHP} action to inspect a dead miner and succeeds on a {@dc 18} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check recognizes the bite marks and burns of a hydra attack.

entries.name: Hydra Lair
entries: Around 225 km into the tunnel, the party comes across a large chamber that serves as the lair of a {@creature Lost Hydra|GWP} with N heads. The hydra has made its home in the chamber, after being released by {@creature Vatlaaw Doomtooth|GWP} to kill the miners and anyone else who tries to use the tunnel. The hydra is aggressive and territorial, and it attacks anyone who enters its lair. The chamber is about 60 feet in diameter, with a high ceiling and several stalactites hanging from above. The hydra is guarding a cluster of eggs, which it will defend fiercely. When they arrive, the hydra is likely to be resting, but it will attack if disturbed.

entries.name: Piken Square
entries: Piken Square is a small military outpost, once used by the ascalonian military, it was used as a command center for {@creature Vatlaaw Doomtooth|GWP} and his followers. They have left it immediately after the tunnel was finished, taking the {@item Searing Cauldron|GWP} with them. The outpost is derelict, with nobody left behind to guard it. The outpost's outer wall connects to the buildings, extending their roofs and walls with a crannelation topped stone wall, with a single wooden gate leading into the {@area main courtyard|GWP3d6b|x} from the south.

The tunnel exits in the small {@area Graveyard|GWP3d6a|x} which connects to the {@area Main Courtyard|GWP3d6b|x} in the east. The {@area Main Courtyard|GWP3d6b|x} connects to the {@area Armory|GWP3d6c|x} in the north, the {@area Barracks|GWP3d6d|x} in the west, and the {@area Mess Hall|GWP3d6e|x} in the south. The {@area Main Courtyard|GWP3d6b|x} also has a staircase leading up to the {@area Watchtower|GWP3d6f|x} in the east. The {@area Armory|GWP3d6c|x} connects to the {@area Smithy|GWP3d6g|x} in the north, and the {@area Storage Room|GWP3d6h|x} in the east. The {@area Barracks|GWP3d6d|x} connects to the {@area Training Room|GWP3d6i|x} in the west. The {@area Mess Hall|GWP3d6e|x} connects to the {@area Kitchen|GWP3d6j|x} in the south. The {@area Watchtower|GWP3d6f|x} connects to the {@area Rooftop|GWP3d6k|x} in the north. The {@area Kitchen|GWP3d6j|x} connects to the {@area Pantry|GWP3d6o|x} in the south.

The graveyard of Piken Sqaure is a small functional space, with a few gravestones and a small mausoleum. The mausoleum is pried open, and obvious excavation marks can be seen around it. In center of the graveyard is a large slab of marble. It is inscribed with the names of the soldiers who died defending Piken Square during the guild wars. Noticibly more rushed and less detailed than the other names, are the names of the soldiers who died in the last battle before the fall of Ascalon. A rusted iron gate leads into the {@area Main Courtyard|GWP3d6b|x} to the east.

entries.name: Mausoleum
entries: The mausoleum is empty, but signs of excavation can be seen around a hole big enough for a small wagon to pass through. The floor is covered in dirt and debris, and there are obvious marks where a heavy object was dragged out. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check reveals scratch marks on the walls, as if something large and clawed was trying to get out. After the Hydra was released, the entrance that was used to get her into the tunnel was sealed off, it then tried to claw its way out, but was unable to do so.

entries.name: Memorial Stone
entries: The memorial stone is inscribed with the names of the soldiers who died defending Piken Square during the guild wars. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill History|XPHB}) check reveals that the names are exclusively ascalonian soldiers, indicating that no mercenaries were trusted with the defense of the outpost. Inspectin the stone more closely, a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check reveals that the stone can be moved, revealing a deep hole beneath it. The hole is about 30 feet deep and 5 feet wide, and filled with the remains of the soldiers who died defending the outpost. The hole was used as a mass grave during the final battle before the fall of Ascalon and afterwards as a dump for the bodies of the captives who died in the construction of the tunnel. The bodies are in various states of decay, and some of them are missing limbs or heads. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check reveals that many of the bodies show signs of having been tortured before death.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The following treasure can be found in the Graveyard:

items: {@b To {@area Main Courtyard|GWP3d6b|x}.} A unlocked rusted iron gate leads into the courtyard to the east.
{@b To {@area Travel Encounters|GWP3d5a|x}.} The other entrance to the tunnel is through the {@area Mausoleum|GWP3d6a2a|x}.

entries: In the center of Piken Square is a large open courtyard, sourrounded by the various buildings of the outpost. The courtyard is overgrown with weeds and vines, and the ground is cracked and uneven. In the center of the courtyard is a large stone fountain, now dry and crumbling. The fountain is inscribed with the symbol of the ascalonian military, a reminder of the outpost's former purpose. To the north is the entrance to the {@area Armory|GWP3d6c|x}, to the west is the entrance to the {@area Barracks|GWP3d6d|x}, to the south is the entrance to the {@area Mess Hall|GWP3d6e|x}. Hunched over the fountain is a skeleton, still clutching a pristine sword and shield. A staircase in the northeast corner of the courtyard leads up to the {@area Watchtower|GWP3d6f|x}. Seemingly scavenging the courtyard is a lone charr.

entries.name: Lone Charr
entries: The lone charr is a {@creature Charr Hunter|GWP} scavenging the courtyard for anything of value. Their name is Rok, they are a Gladium, and they are wary of outsiders, but they are willing to talk if approached carefully. They are willing to trade information for supplies or weapons. They have the following information:

items: {@b The Outpost.} Rok knows that the outpost was once a military outpost, but they don't know much about its history. They do know that it was abandoned after the fall of Ascalon, and that it has been scavenged by various groups over the years. Most recently, it was used by {@creature Vatlaaw Doomtooth|GWP} and his followers as a base of operations while they were constructing the tunnel.

{@b The Tunnel.} Rok has heard rumors of a tunnel that leads from the outpost to somewhere else, but they don't know where it goes. They do know that it is dangerous, and that people have died that entered it.

{@b The Searing Cauldron.} Rok has heard of a large cauldron that was supposedly stored in the outpost, but they don't know where it is now. {@creature Vatlaaw Doomtooth|GWP} brought it with him when he first arrived, but it was gone when Rok arrived a few days ago.
{@b Former Warband.} Rok's warband was wiped out by {@creature Vatlaaw Doomtooth|GWP} and his followers, and they are the only survivor.

{@b Captured Human.} Rok captured a human that was exploring the outpost when they arrived. They have been keeping them alive but don't know what to do with him. They believe he might be able to take revenge on {@creature Vatlaaw Doomtooth|GWP}.
{@b Large Nest.} Rok has seen a large nest on the roof of {@area Watchtower|GWP3d6f|x}, but they have not seen any creatures around it.
{@b Weird Noises.} Rok has heard strange noises coming from the {@area Armory|GWP3d6g|x}, but they don't know what is causing them.

entries.name: Fountain
entries: The fountain is dry and crumbling, but it is still a beautiful piece of architecture. The fountain is inscribed with the symbol of the ascalonian military, a reminder of the outpost's former purpose. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill History|XPHB}) check reveals that the fountain was built to commemorate a battle that took place during the guild wars. A successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check reveals that there is something shiny at the bottom of the fountain. The fountain is about 10 feet deep.

entries.name: Skeleton
entries: The skeleton is clad in the colors of the ascalonian military, and they are still clutching a pristine sword and shield. A successful {@dc 12} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check reveals that the skeleton has been dead for several months and that they likely died of blunt force trauma to the head. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check reveals that there are signs of a struggle, indicating that the skeleton was likely attacked before they died. When talking to the skeleton with {@spell Speak With Dead|XPHB}, they reveal the that the outpost was once a bustling military outpost, but it has been abandoned after the charr attack on Ascalon. The soldiers who were stationed here were either killed or captured during the fall of Ascalon.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: In the Main Courtyard is the following creature:

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The following treasure can be found in the Main Courtyard:

entries.caption: Treasure
rows: Clutched in the hands of the skeleton, only a successful {@dc 15} Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check can retrieve them

items: {@b To {@area Graveyard|GWP3d6a|x}.} A rusted iron gate leads into the graveyard to the west.
{@b To {@area Armory|GWP3d6c|x}.} A wooden door leads into the armory to the north.
{@b To {@area Barracks|GWP3d6d|x}.} A wooden door leads into the barracks to the west.
{@b To {@area Mess Hall|GWP3d6e|x}.} A wooden door leads into the mess hall to the south.
{@b To {@area Watchtower|GWP3d6f|x}.} A staircase in the northeast corner of the courtyard leads up to the watchtower.

entries: Empty weapons racks line the walls of the armory, many of them broken or rusted. A few scattered weapons and pieces of armor lie on the floor, but most of the equipment has been taken or destroyed. In one corner of the room is a large wooden crate, its lid ajar. Scittering can be heard from within.

entries.name: Weapon Racks
entries: The weapon racks are mostly empty, with only a few rusted swords and broken shields remaining.

entries.name: Crate
entries: The crate is old and weathered, but it is still sturdy. Inside the crate is a nest of {@creature Rust Devourer|GWP}, which attack anyone who approaches. A successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check reveals the rust devourers before they attack.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: In the Armory are the following creatures:

entries.caption: Creatures
rows: Crawling in and out of the crate

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The following treasure can be found in the Armory:

entries.caption: Treasure
rows: At the bottom of the crate, after defeating the {@creature Rust Devourer|GWP}
Tucked in a barrel in the corner of the room
Tucked in a barrel in the corner of the room
Tucked in a barrel in the corner of the room
Tucked in a barrel in the corner of the room
Tucked in a barrel in the corner of the room
Tucked in a barrel in the corner of the room

items: {@b To {@area Main Courtyard|GWP3d6b|x}.} A wooden door leads into the courtyard to the south.
{@b To {@area Smithy|GWP3d6g|x}.} A wooden door in the north of the armory leads into the smithy.
{@b To {@area Storage Room|GWP3d6h|x}.} A wooden door in the east of the armory leads into the storage room.

entries: Rotting cots and broken furniture are strewn about the barracks. The central western wall is covered in mold and mildew, and the floor is slick with slime. In one corner of the room is a pile of bones, likely the remains of a soldier who died here long ago. A few rusted weapons and pieces of armor lie scattered about, but most of the equipment has been taken or destroyed.

entries.name: Wall Mold
entries: The mold on the wall is 10 feet wide patch of {@hazard Yellow Mold|XDMG}, which releases spores when disturbed. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Nature|XPHB}) check reveals the mold's properties.

entries.name: Bone Pile
entries: The pile of bones is the remains of a soldier who likely died here long ago. A successful {@dc 12} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check reveals that the bones have been here for roughly a year. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check reveals that there are signs of trauma on the bones, indicating that the soldier likely died in battle. The skull has been crushed, likely from a blunt force trauma.

entries.name: Slime
entries: The slime on the floor is a 10-foot radius patch. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Nature|XPHB}) check reveals that the slime is the result of a {@creature Magma Blister|GWP} that has been here for some time. The {@creature Magma Blister|GWP} is above the slime, hidden in the ceiling rafters.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: In the Barracks are the following creatures:

entries.caption: Creatures
rows: 1 {@creature Magma Blister|GWP} with and additional (N - 2) * 15 HP (minimum 1)
In the ceiling rafters, above the slime

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The following treasure can be found in the Barracks:

items: {@b To {@area Main Courtyard|GWP3d6b|x}.} A wooden door leads into the courtyard to the east.
{@b To {@area Training Room|GWP3d6i|x}.} A wooden door in the south of the barracks leads into the training room.

entries: A somewhat orderly mess hall, with long wooden tables and benches. The walls are adorned with burnt and faded banners, remnants of the outpost's former glory. The tables are littered with broken dishes and scraps of food, and the air is thick with the smell of rotten food. In one corner of the room is a large fireplace, its hearth cold and empty.

entries.name: Fireplace
entries: The fireplace is large and made of stone, the hearth empty and cold. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check reveals a series of half burnt documents hidden in the ashes. The documents contain the following information:

items: {@b Charr Occupation.} Shorty after the fall of Ascalon, the Charr moved into the outpost and began using it as a forward base of operations. They had been her for several months before moving on a few weeks ago.
{@b Cauldron of the Flame.} On the orders of {@creature Vatlaaw Doomtooth|GWP}, a cauldron was brought to Piken Square and stored until it could be moved south of the Great Northern Wall.

{@b Time of the Attack.} Based on the theories by the leading Flame Shamans the "Great Push" has the highest chance of success when the Shadow of the Mad King is looming. This event happens once every year, and is at its strongest on the 34th day in the Season of the Colossus.
{@b Location south of the Wall.} After scouting the area {@creature Vatlaaw Doomtooth|GWP} has determined that the best location to set up the cauldron is in the hills just south of Ascalon City.
{@b To {@area Main Courtyard|GWP3d6b|x}.} A wooden door leads into the courtyard to the north.
{@b To {@area Kitchen|GWP3d6j|x}.} A wooden door in the south of the mess hall leads into the kitchen.

entries: A spiral staircase leads up to the top of the watchtower, where a small platform offers a view of the surrounding area. Halfway up the tower a door exits on to the roofs of the other buildings. The tower is well-preserved compared to the rest of the outpost, with sturdy wooden beams and a solid stone foundation. A few broken arrows and pieces of armor lie scattered about, remnants of past battles. From this vantage point, one can see the dense forest surrounding the outpost, as well as the distant outline of the mountains to the west and east. The Great Northern Wall can be seen to the southwest, a reminder of the hubris of the humans who once lived here. A large bird nest sits in one corner, huge feathers scattered around it.

entries.name: Interior
entries: Clear remnants of a fierce battle can be seen in the watchtower. Scratches and dents mar the wooden beams, and a few broken arrows and pieces of armor lie scattered about. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check reveals that the battle likely took place several months ago, based on the state of the debris. The scratches and dents suggest that the defenders fought bravely, but were ultimately overwhelmed by a larger force.

entries.name: Nest
entries: The nest is large and made of twigs and leaves, with a few large feathers scattered around it. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Nature|XPHB}) check reveals that the nest belongs to a {@creature Blazeridge Griffon|GWP}. Morsels of man-made food can be found in the nest, indicating that the griffon has been fed by someone in the past. A successful {@dc 17} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check reveals that the nest has been abandoned recently, likely within the past few weeks.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The following treasure can be found in the Watchtower :

entries.caption: Treasure
rows: In the wreckage of the battle
A pouch with 1d4 pinches of {@item Dust of Disappearance|XDMG}

items: {@b To {@area Main Courtyard|GWP3d6b|x}.} A wooden door at the base of the tower leads into the courtyard to the west.
{@b To {@area Rooftop|GWP3d6k|x}.} A door halfway up the tower leads out onto the rooftops of the other buildings.

entries: The smithy is a small, cluttered room filled with the tools of the trade. An anvil sits in one corner, surrounded by various hammers and tongs. A forge, now cold and covered in ash, dominates another corner of the room. Shelves line the walls, holding various pieces of armor and weapons in various states of repair. The air is thick with the smell of soot and metal.

entries.name: Tools
entries: A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check reveals that the tools in the smithy are of high quality, likely made by a skilled blacksmith. The anvil is well-worn, with numerous dents and scratches from years of use. The hammers and tongs are also in good condition, though they show signs of heavy use. The forge is cold and covered in ash, indicating that it has not been used in some time. A successful {@dc 12} Intelligence ({@item Smith's Tools|XPHB}) check reveals that the tools are both human and charr in origin, suggesting that the smithy was used by both parties.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The following treasure can be found in the Smithy:

items: {@b To {@area Armory|GWP3d6c|x}.} A wooden door in the south of the smithy leads into the armory.
{@b To {@area Storage Room|GWP3d6h|x}.} A wooden door in the east of the smithy leads into the storage room.

entries: Empty crates and barrels are stacked haphazardly around the storage room. Many of them are broken or rotting, and a thick layer of dust covers everything. A few scattered supplies lie on the floor, but most of the equipment has been taken or destroyed. A large area in one corner of the room appears to have been cleared, a circular indentation in the floor marking where something heavy once sat.

entries.name: Indentation
entries: The indentation in the floor is roughly 5 feet in diameter and 1/2 foot deep. A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check reveals that the indentation was likely made by a large cauldron or similar object, which has since been removed.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The following treasure can be found in the Storage Room:

items: {@b To {@area Smithy|GWP3d6g|x}.} A wooden door in the west of the storage room leads into the smithy.
{@b To {@area Armory|GWP3d6c|x}.} A wooden door in the west of the storage room leads into the armory.

entries: Half rotten wooden dummies stand in various states of disrepair around the training room. Some are missing limbs, while others are splintered and cracked. The floor is littered with broken arrows and discarded weapons, and a few tattered targets hang on the walls. A thick layer of dust covers everything, and the air smells of mildew and decay. Bound up in one corner is a unconscious human soldier, his armor battered and torn.

entries.name: Training Dummies
entries: The training dummies are in various states of disrepair, with some missing limbs and others splintered and cracked. The vengeful spirits of the soldiers who once trained here seem to linger, and a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check reveals faint whispers and ghostly apparitions moving among the dummies. If they are disturbed, the spirits will become hostile possessing the dummies and attacking intruders.

entries.name: Unconscious Soldier
entries: The unconscious soldier is a human ranger called {@creature Aidan|GW}. He is badly injured, with several deep cuts and bruises covering his body. A successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check reveals that he is suffering from severe dehydration and blood loss. If he is not treated within the next hour, he will succumb to his injuries. If revived, he will be grateful and offer to join the party as a guide through the area and has the following information to share:

items: {@b Charr Attack.} The outpost was attacked by a large force of Charr several months ago. Many of the soldiers were killed or captured, and the survivors were forced to flee into the surrounding forest.
{@b Searing Cauldron.} The Charr were keeping a powerful artifact called the Searing Cauldron in the outpost. They seemed convinced that it would help them in their war against the humans.

{@b Current Location of the Cauldron.} Aidan does not know where the Cauldron is currently located, but he believes that it may have been taken south of the Great Northern Wall, possibly to be used in an upcoming attack on Ascalon City.

{@b What happened to him?.} Aidan learned from a surviving soldier that charr had taken up residence in the outpost after the attack. He watched them and moved in to investigate after they left, but was ambushed and left for dead in the training room.
{@b More Information.} Aidan is sure that there is more information to be found in the outpost, particularly in the mess hall.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: In the Training Room are the following creatures:

entries.caption: Creatures
rows: Training Dummies possessed by vengeful spirits

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The following treasure can be found in the Training Room:

entries.caption: Treasure
rows: In a barrel near the door

items: {@b To {@area Barracks|GWP3d6a|x}.} A wooden door in the south of the training room leads into the barracks.

entries: Remnents of a meal are scattered across a long wooden table in the center of the kitchen. A few rotting vegetables and a half-eaten loaf of bread sit on a plate, while a rusty knife lies nearby. The fireplace is cold and filled with ashes, and a few broken pots and pans are strewn about the room.

entries.name: Food Remnants
entries: A successful {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check reveals that the food remnants are fresh.

items: {@b To {@area Mess Hall|GWP3d6e|x}.} A wooden door in the north of the kitchen leads into the mess hall.
{@b To {@area Pantry|GWP3d6l|x}.} A wooden door in the east of the kitchen leads into the pantry.

entries: A door connects the rooftop to the watchtower at halfway up the tower. The flat roof allows access to the battlements, which are lined with crenellations.

items: {@b To {@area Watchtower|GWP3d6f|x}.} A door halfway up the tower leads down into the watchtower.

entries: A tiny pantry filled with rotting food and broken shelves. The smell of decay is overwhelming, and a few rats scurry about the room. A large hole in one wall appears to have been chewed through, possibly by the rats.

entries.name: Rats
entries: After the charr left the already bad rat infestation got worse. A successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check reveals the presence of several large rats scurrying about the pantry. If disturbed, they will become hostile and attack intruders.
