entries.name: Lion’s Arch
entries: Lion’s Arch

items: {@i {@b An adventure for Level 8 characters.}}
{@i Designed to span two to four sessions, including overland travel and a multi-room dungeon.}

entries.name: Key Plot Points
entries: The following information is key to the adventure's story:

items.name: A Land infested by Undead
items.entry: Kryta always had its share of undead, but the recent rise in their numbers is alarming. The Shining Blade and White Mantle are both investigating the cause, both have come to the same conclusion: the Mausoleum of the Kryta Royal Family houses the solution to the undead problem. They believe that the Scepter of Orr, a powerful artifact, is the key to ending the undead threat. The Scepter is rumored to be hidden in the Mausoleum, guarded by powerful undead and other dangers.

items.name: Strife for the Scepter
items.entry: Three factions are vying for the Scepter of Orr: the Shining Blade, the White Mantle, and Vizier Khilbron. The Shining Blade seeks to use the Scepter to end the undead threat, while the White Mantle wants to use it to gain power and control over Kryta. Vizier Khilbron, on the other hand, seeks to use the Scepter to open the Door of Komalie, and unleash the Titans.

items.name: A Mad King’s Legacy
items.entry: The Mausoleum was built by the first Krytan Monarch, King Mazdak, and later expanded by his descendants. However, it was Mad King Thorn who added the most dangerous defenses to the Mausoleum, including traps, undead guardians, and other dangers. The party must navigate these defenses to reach the Scepter of Orr. One of these defenses captured a powerful demon and god to the White Mantle, the Mursaat Lazarus the Dire who now is in the possession of scepter but cannot leave.

entries.name: Preparation
entries: Before running the adventure, prepare as follows:

items.name: Step 1
items.entry: Read the {@area Recommended Proficiencies and Spells|GWP6c3|x} section.

items.name: Step 3
items.entry: Familiarize yourself with the Key NPCs table below; the characters will interact with these individuals throughout the adventure.

items: {@creature Animated Armor|XMM}

entries.caption: Key NPCs
rows: Trapped god of the White Mantle

entries.name: Recommended Proficiencies and Spells
entries: You can run this adventure for any number of Level 8 characters. Ideally, the party should include proficiency in at least two of the following skills:

items: {@skill Arcana}
{@skill Investigation}
{@skill Perception}
{@skill Religion}

entries: Access to the following spells is also helpful:

items: {@spell dispel magic|xphb}

entries.name: The Scepter of Orr
entries: The Scepter of Orr is a powerful artifact gifted to the humans of Orr by the humand gods. It is said to have the power to control beings from the mists, including the undead. The Scepter was lost when Orr sunk beneath the waves, but it is rumored to be hidden in the Mausoleum of the Krytan Royal Family. The Shining Blade and White Mantle are both seeking the Scepter, but for different reasons.

The Shining Blade seeks to use the Scepter to end the undead threat, and potentially overthrow the White Mantle. Especially Livia is interested in the Scepter, as it is rumored to be able to control the undead. The White Mantle, on the other hand, seeks to use the Scepter to gain power and control over Kryta. Vizier Khilbron, a Lich, is also seeking the Scepter, but for his own purposes. He believes that the Scepter can be used to open the Door of Komalie, and unleash the Titans upon the world.

The last faction seeking the Scepter is the Mursaat Lazarus the Dire, who is a powerful demon and god to the White Mantle. He is imprisoned in the Mausoleum, and cannot leave. He seeks the Scepter to prevent the White Mantle from using it against him, or other Mursaat. He also believes that the him having the sceptre could prevent the Flameseeker Prophecies from coming true, and the Mursaat being destroyed.

entries.name: The Mausoleum
entries: The Mausoleum of the Krytan Royal Family is a vast, ancient crypt that houses the remains of the Krytan monarchs. It is said to be haunted by the spirits of the dead, and many adventurers have entered its depths in search of treasure and glory, only to never return. The Mausoleum is also rumored to contain powerful artifacts, including the Scepter of Orr, which is said to have the power to control the undead. It is guarded by a powerful undead dragon known as Rotscale, and other dangers.

Rotscale was tasked by King Mazdak to guard the Mausoleum, and prevent anyone with ill intent from entering. She is a powerful dragon, but will allow passage to those who prove their intentions are pure, and that they seek to end the undead threat. She is also bound by a pact with the Shining Blade, and will not attack them unless provoked.

The Mausoleum itself has been retrofitted with traps and defenses by Mad King Thorn, making it a dangerous place to explore. Two other parties have tried and failed to get to the Scepter of Orr: the White Mantle, and Vizier Khilbron.

entries.name: Travel to the Mausoleum from Lion's Arch
entries: Reaching the Mausoleum can be done overland from Lion’s Arch or by sea to Sanctum Cay and then north. Typical paces and narrative notes are provided below. Adjust for mounts, magic, hazards, and player choices.

entries.name: Lion’s Arch → Mausoleum (Overland)
entries: {@b Distance.} 1,000 km; {@b Terrain.} swampy roads through rural Kryta to the Maguuma border; {@b Travel Pace.} normal 26 days; slow 35 days.

The route passes sparse hamlets and caravans, with Lionguard patrols thinning far from Lion’s Arch. The land grows wilder toward the Maguuma border as jungle mixes with swamp and mesas rise from the marsh.

entries.name: Lion’s Arch → Sanctum Cay (Sea)
entries: {@b Distance.} 590 km; {@b Terrain.} ocean; {@b Travel Pace.} normal 8 days.
A coastal voyage with few other vessels sighted.

entries.name: Sanctum Cay → Mausoleum (Overland)
entries: {@b Distance.} 650 km; {@b Terrain.} swampy roads skirting the bay northward; {@b Travel Pace.} normal 17 days; slow 22 days.
Traffic includes farmers and guards bound for Fisherman’s Haven and Lion’s Arch; the land again grows wilder near the Maguuma border.

entries.name: Dolphins’ Warning
entries: A school of {@creature dolphin|MPMM}, led by a {@creature dolphin delighter|MPMM|dolphin delighter} named Roseskin, paces the ship. Conversing with her (via magic or creative means) earns a warning about harpies ahead. Skirting the threat adds a day to the voyage; facing it now grants a few characters temporary hit points, at the DM’s discretion. If the party leaves a particularly good impression, there’s a 50% chance a dolphin rescues anyone who falls overboard during this leg.

entries.name: Harpy Ambush
entries: Eight {@creature coastal harpy|GWP} attempt to wreck the ship—half remain on coastal rocks using Luring Song while the others tear rigging and pitch sailors overboard.

entries.name: A Storm Aproaches
entries: A storm front approaches the ship. Sailing around it adds a day to the voyage. Sailing into it requires a coordinated effort to not incur any damage to the ship or lose crew.

entries.name: Dragon Sighting
entries: Very rarely can the crystalline dragon {@creature glint|GWP} be seen flying high over the Krytan countryside. She is surveying the land and making sure all goes according to her prophecy. Reaching her is impossible; she will use her prophetic abilities to stop any attempt to reach her.

entries.name: Stormy Winds
entries: Heavy winds threaten all fliers in a large area. To continue flying, a creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw for each hour of travel. On a failure they are forced to ground and must continue on foot until the storm passes. On a success, they make half the normal distance.

entries.name: An Oncoming Disaster
entries: From high above, a group of refugees is visible. They are about to be surprised by a forest fire raging through the area. A safe place to weather the fire is close by if they can be led there in time.

entries.name: The Restless
entries: Camp is assailed by N-1 {@creature Rotting Dead|GWP} and 1 {@creature Rotting Maw|GWP}. The undead attempt to overwhelm sleepers before fleeing daylight or superior force.

entries.name: Nicholas and Yakkington
entries: On the road, the party meets {@creature Nicholas Sandford|GW} and his trusty yak, {@creature Professor Yakkington|GW}—offer his current wares at whatever discount they’ve earned so far.

entries.name: Will-o’-Wisps’ Dance
entries: A troupe of 2 × N {@creature Swamp Lights|GWP} drifts overhead around midnight. If unprovoked, they dance and disperse. If engaged, they focus the weakest target with Consume Life, then retreat toward their grove if endangered. Following unseen leads to a Spiritwood stand; harvesting yields up to 50 planks with a full day’s work (roughly 4 planks/hour) under daylight.

entries.name: Refugees from Lonely Creek
entries: A caravan of Krytan refugees led by {@creature Commoner|XMM|Marianne Strawsoul} reports rising undead activity near Lonely Creek and a lack of aid. If asked about Ingrid Oakheart, Marianne recalls a medicine woman who left years ago, abandoning her hut.

entries.name: The Ape Raid… and Worse
entries: A band of 2 × N {@creature swamp ape|GWP} led by 1 {@creature giant swamp ape|GWP} raids for supplies. If all are asleep, a {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check notices the theft in time; otherwise the apes surprise the camp.

At the end of round 2, N + 1 {@creature rotting tyrannosaurus|GWP} crash into the scene, chasing both apes and PCs. Run a wilderness chase (see {@book Dungeon Master’s Guide|XDMG|2|Beginning a Chase} and {@book Dungeon Master’s Guide|XDMG|2|Chase Complications}).
You can end this chase around Lonely Creek, which is close to Ingrid Oakheart's old hut.

entries.name: The Hut in the Bog

entries: Fog clings to rotting posts and rust-eaten blades that jut from the peat. A faint, beckoning light dances deeper in the mire. Ahead squats a wide-roofed hut on stilts beside a crude pen—inside, two hulking, reeking beasts loom over a smaller shape.

Ivy might recognize the hut as distinctly Norn-built. The pen holds two {@creature catoblepas|MPMM} guarding what appears to be a calf—but in truth they’re warding a paralyzed prisoner of the hag inside: {@creature Livia|GWP} of the Shining Blade under a silent illusion. A character can discern the illusion with a {@dc 17} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. Removing a black thorn from Livia’s flesh with a {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check ends the paralysis.

Inside lurks {@creature Arboria Woodcurse|GWP}, a wood hag, who offers safe passage for a body part. If refused, she uses Animate Hut (action), ejecting intruders and dropping concentration on {@spell silent image|xphb}. A {@creature corpse flower|MPMM} attacks from behind the hut once the fight begins.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Among crates and hooks the party finds:
A trapped closet ({@spell glyph of warding|xphb} – contagion; {@dc 17} Wisdom [{@skill Perception}] to notice) contains heirlooms Ingrid left for Ivy:

Ingrid’s journal outlines research into druids, Maguuma, and a 10,000-year stellar cycle. She left for the druid village of Maguuma Stade. A final message to Ivy bequeaths the gear and urges her to seek Ingrid when ready.

entries.name: Shining Blade Camp
entries: Livia leads the party to a Shining Blade outpost in Dakutu Village to meet {@creature Evennia|GW} and {@creature Markis|GW}. If the characters reveal dealings with the White Mantle, the Blade warns caution: the ‘Unseen Gods,’ motives in Kryta, the Eye of Janthir, and the fate of the Chosen remain uncertain. The party may rest here and receive a guide to the Mausoleum entrance.

entries.name: MA1: Exterior

entries: A rough-hewn stone platform juts from jungle growth. Six vine-choked pillars frame a grand stair half-buried in debris. At its summit, before a spiked portal, a colossal bone dragon crouches—four smaller drakes flanking like sentries.

{@b Rotscale’s Vigil.} {@creature Rotscale|GWP|Adult Bone Dragon} guards the gate with four {@creature Young Bone Dragon|GWP}. While within 1 mile of the lair (but not inside the dungeon), bone spikes make all non-ally travel difficult terrain, and local water is corrupted: a creature that drinks it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

entries.name: Parley with the Guardian
entries: Rotscale was tasked by King Mazdak to bar intruders. She allows passage only if convinced the party will end the undead threat by securing the {@item Scepter of Orr|GW}. Showing the proper key to the final vault (the Key of Madness) and a credible plan suffices. She doesn’t pursue fleeing foes. When the party returns carrying the Scepter, she overlooks other pilfered loot and, if they spoke with King Jadon within, gifts the recorded spells {@spell Grenth's Balance|GW} and {@spell Feast of Corruption|GW} into a party member’s {@item Tome of Capture|GW}.

entries.name: MA2: Entombed Royalty

entries: Chill, dry air replaces jungle humidity. A 10-foot-wide passage stretches 150 feet, paneled in ornate stone. Every five feet a niche holds a sarcophagus with weathered copper nameplates long since corroded away.
{@b Rite of Respect.} To pass unmolested, creatures must bow before each sarcophagus; ignore the rite and a {@creature mummy|XMM} emerges to attack.

{@b King Jadon’s Shade.} At the T-intersection midway lies the spirit of King Jadon. He relates how his death led to the Mausoleum’s defenses (by Mad King Thorn) trapping {@creature Lazarus the Dire|GWP} within, making entry impossible without the Key of Madness. King Jadon’s own coffin stands broken and empty.

{@b Door to A3.} Wooden door (AC 15, 18 hp) locked; {@dc 15} Dexterity ({@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}) to pick. Trap: {@spell glyph of warding|xphb} (finger of death), {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) to notice.

entries.name: MA3: Embalming Room

entries: A coppery tang of old blood hangs over two stone slabs beside ranks of canopic jars. Hooks and embalming tools line the walls. A leather-bound ledger rests on a writing desk.
{@b Jars & Tools.} Ancient organs (one fresh set), and well-kept, high-quality implements of mummification.

entries.name: Royal Ledger
entries: The ledger records mummifications across the ages (sample shown):
A {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill History}) check recalls Kryta’s Elonian occupation after 300 AE, explains gaps, and notes the incongruity of Jadon’s interment here.

{@b Hidden Chest.} An invisible chest sits in the southwest corner (find with {@dc 20} Intelligence [{@skill Investigation}] while searching that corner). Opening requires {@dc 25} Dexterity ({@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}).

entries.name: Treasure
entries: A false bottom ({@dc 20} Wisdom [{@skill Perception}] or {@dc 17} Intelligence [{@skill Investigation}] while open) hides:

entries.caption: False Bottom
rows: {@spell Signet of Devotion|GW|Scroll of Signet of Devotion}

entries.name: MA4: The Acid Room

entries: Acid stings your nose. Two narrow channels run along the long walls, fed by southern ceiling grates and draining north through floor grates. An ornate double door faces the way you came.

{@b Layout.} 30×45-foot room. Iron grates (AC 17, 52 hp) bolt into stone; acid flows continuously. A 5-foot stretch of the west wall is illusory, its threshold 1 foot above the acid (notice with {@dc 20} Intelligence [{@skill Investigation}] when examining that spot). The northern double door is a fake, discoverable with {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) or by any lockpicking attempt that beats {@dc 25} but finds no mechanism.
{@b Acid.} Contact deals {@damage 4d6} acid; fully submerging a nonmagical, non-stone, non-iron item dissolves it in 1 round.
{@b Symbols.} Two {@spell symbol|xphb} (Sleep) glyphs are inscribed mid-room (find {@dc 16} Wisdom [{@skill Perception}], save {@dc 16} Wisdom).

{@b Timer & Puddings.} Five rounds after the first creature enters, the entry door slams shut and locks (steel; AC 19, 72 hp, DC 25). Simultaneously, two {@creature black pudding|XMM} ooze out of the northern drains, clogging them. Starting on the next round, acid spreads 10 feet per round from each drain. Defeating the oozes doesn’t clear the blockage; a creature adjacent to a drain can use an action and either succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check or a {@dc 17} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check to clear it, taking acid contact in the process.

entries.name: Pudding Loot
entries: Each puddle contains half-digested gear:

entries.caption: Black Pudding Drops
rows: {@item Shield of Blinding|bookofebontides} (unidentified); Black 1-foot orb (see {@area A8: Ray Puzzle|GWP6c8h|x})

entries.name: MA5: Storage Room
entries: Shelves of bandages, resins, and masonry tools surround a central workbench—everything needed for embalming and internment. A {@dc 18} Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check notes recent use within the last two years. Many groups who escape A4 via teleport arrive here.

entries.name: MA6: Corridor of Golems

entries: A broad hall ends at a massive door without a keyhole. Torches along the walls glow in shifting hues opposite hulking statues, each set with a differently colored gem and a distinct expression.

{@b Door.} Immune to damage unless dispelled ({@spell dispel magic|xphb} at {@dc 15}); then it becomes a normal steel door (AC 19, 72 hp, DC 25). Three gem-sockets form a triangle; placing gems totaling 3,500 gp or more opens the door.

{@b Puzzle.} Set each torch’s color to match the expression of the statue opposite it by dealing one of the listed damage types to the torch. Disturbing a torch, trying to move it, tampering with a gem, or setting the wrong color awakens the corresponding golem to attack. Setting the correct color causes the golem to place its gem in the door, then return to its post.

{@b Secret.} Behind the second statue: secret door ({@dc 20} Wisdom [{@skill Perception}] or {@dc 15} Intelligence [{@skill Investigation}]; DCs –5 while its golem is away). Stone door (AC 17, 40 hp, DC 20) is locked.

entries.name: MA7: Royal Treasury

entries: A round chamber with a lavish rug. Three chests sit at the cardinal points, firelight dancing on polished hinges.

Mad King Thorn stored his hoard here—and trapped it. Each chest is a {@creature mimic|XMM}, and the carpet is an {@creature animated rug of smothering|XMM}. Speaking “{@italic Mad King Thorn says freeze!}” (or similar) on entry pacifies them; otherwise, opening any chest triggers all to attack.
{@b Rug.} Worth 450 gp if intact.

entries.caption: Treasury Contents (by Chest)
rows: 367 gp; {@item Watch of Prospecting|whereevillives}; Orange 1-foot orb (see {@area A8: Ray Puzzle|GWP6c8h|x}); {@spell Martyr|GW|Scroll of Martyr}

entries.name: MA8: Ray Puzzle

entries: Beyond a heavy door lies a small chamber with a corridor opposite. A pedestal in the center bears a softly glowing green orb. Branching off the corridor are four pairs of side tunnels; at the ends, faint shimmers and grim visages await.
{@b Anti-Magic.} Each orb is tied to an anti-magic field; destroying an orb expands the field 5 feet eastward along the corridor. If enough are destroyed, the field eventually blankets the center.

items: {@b Red.} Nearly indestructible—only the mightiest destruction magic can break it. Counter: Disintegration ray.
{@b Black.} Teeming with life energy; only the foulest magic can snuff it. Counter: Death ray.
{@b Orange.} Buzzing with motion; stasis spells doom it. Counter: Petrification ray.
{@b Green.} A delicate purifying system destroyed by disruption. Counter: Enervation ray.

entries: {@b Faces & Rays.} Each eastern alcove bears a face that fires when a creature or the matching orb stands before it: Enervation (Con {@dc 16}; {@damage 3d8} poison and {@condition poisoned} [no healing] on fail), Petrification (Con {@dc 16}; {@condition restrained} on first failure, becomes {@condition petrified} on second), Death (Dex {@dc 16}; {@damage 10d10} necrotic; target dies if reduced to 0 hp), Disintegration (Dex {@dc 16}; {@damage 8d8} force; object/force creations disintegrate; a creature reduced to 0 hp turns to dust). A beam striking the anti-magic field or its corresponding orb dissipates and destroys that orb.
{@b Exit.} Steel door to A9 (AC 19, 72 hp, DC 25) is locked.

entries.name: MA9: Antechamber of the Vault
entries: Stairs descend to monumental doors with no keyhole. They open only to the Key of Madness and resist all other entry.

entries.name: MA10: Treasure Vault

entries: Laughter echoes as the doors grind open. A triangular chamber spreads before you, two acid streams sliding from the rear corners toward the far tip. Six pillars flank the flows. Hovering at the center, clawed and radiant with spectral pinions, stands a golden-armored figure gripping a baroque scepter—and looking exhausted.

{@b Lazarus the Dire.} The Mursaat necromancer has waited centuries. On entry he seals the rear grates (as in A4: AC 15, 50 hp, or {@spell dispel magic|xphb}) and attacks, leveraging eye rays to inflict conditions before using {@spell virulence|GW}. He hovers over acid and uses telekinesis to hurl foes into the streams. If the party hides behind pillars, he blasts them with disintegration; a ruined pillar collapses the ceiling around it, creating difficult terrain and forcing creatures within 5 feet to make a Dexterity save {@dc 16} or take {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning and fall {@condition prone}.

{@b Resolution.} When defeated, the acid stops, dungeon traps deactivate, and Lazarus promises a deadlier rematch before disintegrating. King Jadon’s spirit appears, recounts his murder and the vault’s history, then departs. The {@item Scepter of Orr|GW} lies at the scene.

entries.name: Conclusion
entries: Outside, a White Mantle detachment demands the Scepter. Handing it over ensures safe passage to Lion’s Arch; refusing without convincing argument provokes a fight.

item.name: Spark (Awakened)
entries: This dagger seems to be pulsing with the heat of battle, getting hotter and hotter during a fight.
'Lift up thy weapons. For you are my soldiers, and must you be steadfast, strong, and brave of heart.' is inscribed on the blade.
You can use Spark as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While Spark is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 fire damage.

• When you deal piercing or psychic damage you can instead deal fire damage. Additionally, any of your features that require you to deal piercing or psychic damage now also work when dealing fire damage.
{@bold Awakened.} When Spark reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6.

• When you give an ally a Bardic Inspiration, they can use their reaction to immediately expend that use to make one weapon attack or cast one cantrip that requires an attack roll, adding one roll of your Bardic Inspiration die to that attack roll.

{@bold Mastery: Nick.}  When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the Attack action instead of as a Bonus Action. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.
item.reqAttune: by a true follower of Balthazar

item.name: Incinerator (Exalted)
entries: 'I know this isn't the path you'd have chosen for yourself — but the Flame Legion isn't just your home now; It is my gift to you. Keep this dagger close and never forget who you are: Nonius Ragesinger.'
'Lift up thy weapons. For you are my soldiers, and must you be steadfast, strong, and brave of heart.' is inscribed on the blade.
You can use Incinerator as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While Incinerator is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 fire damage.

• When you deal piercing or psychic damage you can instead deal fire damage. Additionally, any of your features that require you to deal piercing or psychic damage now also work when dealing fire damage.
{@bold Awakened.} When Incinerator reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6.

• When you give an ally a Bardic Inspiration, they can use their reaction to immediately expend that use to make one weapon attack or cast one cantrip that requires an attack roll, adding one roll of your Bardic Inspiration die to that attack roll.
{@bold Exalted.} When Incinerator reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +3.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +3.
• The extra damage dealt by the weapon increases to 3d6.
• When you score a critical hit you can cause flames to erupt from the creature struck. Each hostile creature within 5 feet of the creature takes half the damage of the critical hit as fire damage.

{@bold Mastery: Nick.}  When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the Attack action instead of as a Bonus Action. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.
item.reqAttune: by a true follower of Balthazar

item.name: Seeker (Dormant)
entries: This light crossbow is in the shape of a dragon's wing.
'Tyria's last hope rests on the unity of the races. The pooling of their strength. It is the only way.' is inscribed on the grip.
You can use Seeker as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While Seeker is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 piercing damage.
• Attack rolls made with this weapon have their critical hit range increased by 1 if your target is within 5 feet of an ally of yours.

{@bold Mastery: Slow.} If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to it, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If the creature is hit more than once by weapons that have this property, the Speed reduction doesn't exceed 10 feet.
item.reqAttune: by a member of the Brotherhood of the Dragon

item.name: Dragon's Wing (Awakened)
entries: This shortbow is in the shape of a dragon's wing.
'Tyria's last hope rests on the unity of the races. The pooling of their strength. It is the only way.' is inscribed on the grip.
You can use Dragon's Wing as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While Dragon's Wing is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 piercing damage.
• Attack rolls made with this weapon have their critical hit range increased by 1 if your target is within 5 feet of an ally of yours.
{@bold Awakened.} When Dragon's Wing reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra piercing damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6.

• At the end of a short rest you can choose one of the following damage types; Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Piercing or Poison. Any arrow shot from this weapon and the extra damage of this weapon now deal damage of the damage type chosen and are considered magical. You can also change the damage type as a bonus action by expending a spell slot of level 1+.
{@bold Mastery: Vex.} If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.
item.reqAttune: by a member of the Brotherhood of the Dragon

item.name: Glint's Wing (Exalted)
entries: This shortbow is in the shape of a dragon's wing.

'I can hear her. Her voice lingers at the edge of my mind like a memory I've long forgotten—the lightest touch. Bubbling beneath the ocean waves, deep below... Her voice, like a feather against my scales.'
'Tyria's last hope rests on the unity of the races. The pooling of their strength. It is the only way.' is inscribed on the grip.
You can use Glint's Wing as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While Glint's Wing is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 piercing damage.
• Attack rolls made with this weapon have their critical hit range increased by 1 if your target is within 5 feet of an ally of yours.
{@bold Awakened.} When Glint's Wing reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra piercing damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6.

• At the end of a short rest you can choose one of the following damage types; Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Piercing or Poison. Any arrow shot from this weapon and the extra damage of this weapon now deal damage of the damage type chosen and are considered magical. You can also change the damage type as a bonus action by expending a spell slot of level 1+.
{@bold Exalted.} When Glint's Wing reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +3.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +3.
• The extra piercing damage dealt by the weapon increases to 3d6.
• Attack rolls made with this weapon have their critical hit range increased by 1 if you have advantage on the attack roll.
{@bold Mastery: Vex.} If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.
item.reqAttune: by a member of the Brotherhood of the Dragon

item.name: The Core (Dormant)
entries: This flaming longsword is made of ornamented deldrimor steel, with a heavy core of infernal iron.
'Offer protection to the weak. Give solace and shelter to those who need it. Be ye a salve to the wounded.' is inscribed on the blade.
You can use The Core as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While The Core is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 fire damage.

• When you score a critical hit against a creature with this weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you can choose to either gain temporary hit points or regain hit points equal to the challenge rating of the creature or your proficiency bonus, whichever is higher.

{@bold Mastery: Graze.}  If your attack roll with this weapon misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can be increased only by increasing the ability modifier.
item.reqAttune: by a member of the Core Warband

item.name: Exitare (Awakened)
entries: This sleek greatsword not only seams to cleave the material plane, but also the mists at the same time.
'Offer protection to the weak. Give solace and shelter to those who need it. Be ye a salve to the wounded.' is inscribed on the blade.
You can use Exitare as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While Exitare is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 fire damage.

• When you score a critical hit against a creature with this weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you can choose to either gain temporary hit points or regain hit points equal to the challenge rating of the creature or your proficiency bonus, whichever is higher.
{@bold Awakened.} When Exitare reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6 and can either be fire or force damage.

• When you score a critical hit against a creature with this weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you can cause flames to erupt, damaging creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you. The fire damage equals the challenge rating of the creature or your proficiency bonus, whichever is higher.

{@bold Mastery: Graze.}  If your attack roll with this weapon misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can be increased only by increasing the ability modifier.

item.name: Exordium (Exalted)
entries: Explorers venture into the Mists, and sometimes the Mists venture back. Though far less sentient than the Mist-being Razah, Exordium takes some joy in adapting to its wielder's needs and expectations.
'Offer protection to the weak. Give solace and shelter to those who need it. Be ye a salve to the wounded.' is inscribed on the blade.
You can use Exordium as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While Exordium is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 fire damage.

• When you score a critical hit against a creature with this weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you can choose to either gain temporary hit points or regain hit points equal to the challenge rating of the creature or your proficiency bonus, whichever is higher.
{@bold Awakened.} When Exordium reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6 and can either be fire or force damage.

• When you score a critical hit against a creature with this weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you can cause flames to erupt, damaging creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you. The fire damage equals the challenge rating of the creature or your proficiency bonus, whichever is higher.
{@bold Exalted.} When Exordium reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +3.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +3.
• The extra damage dealt by the weapon increases to 3d6 and can be any damage type.

• Once on your turn, when you score a critical hit against a creature with this weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you can make one extra melee weapon attack as part of your attack action.

{@bold Mastery: Special.} When attacking with Exordium is conforms to your will, transforming itself into a form best suited to the situation. When you make an attack roll with Exordium choose which of the following mastery property you want to use for that attack:

{@bold Mastery: Cleave.} If you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using this weapon, you can make a melee attack roll with the weapon against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the weapon's damage, but don't add your ability modifier to that damage unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

{@bold Mastery: Graze.} If your attack roll with this weapon misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can be increased only by increasing the ability modifier.
{@bold Mastery: Push.} If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can push the creature up to 10 feet straight away from yourself if it is Large or smaller.
{@bold Mastery: Sap.} If you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of your next turn.

{@bold Mastery: Slow.} If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to it, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If the creature is hit more than once by weapons that have this property, the Speed reduction doesn't exceed 10 feet.

{@bold Mastery: Topple.} If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus the ability modifier used to make the attack roll and your Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, the creature has the Prone condition.
{@bold Mastery: Vex.} If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

item.name: Celestial Slicer (Dormant)
entries: This silver-bladed sickle glimmers softly with moonlight. When looking at the reflection on the blade you can see the night sky.
'Lead through actions, not words!' is inscribed on the silver blade.
You can use the Celestial Slicer as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
You can use the Celestial Slicer as a star map while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While the Celestial Slicer is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 radiant damage.
• When you make a ranged spell attack roll against a creature, you can target one additional creature within range and make a second attack roll against it.

{@bold Mastery: Nick.} When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the Attack action instead of as a Bonus Action. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.
item.reqAttune: by a circle of the stars druid

item.name: The Mechanism (Awakened)
entries: This silver-bladed axe glimmers softly with moonlight. When looking at the reflection on the blade you can see the night sky.
'Lead through actions, not words!' is inscribed on the silver blade.
You can use the The Mechanism as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
You can use the The Mechanism as a star map while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While the The Mechanism is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 radiant damage.
• When you make a ranged spell attack roll against a creature, you can target one additional creature within range and make a second attack roll against it.
{@bold Awakened.} When the The Mechanism reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra radiant damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6.
• When you use your cosmic omen feature, you can expend a spell slot of any level to forgo rolling the die and instead take the highest possible result.
{@bold Mastery: Vex.} If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.
item.reqAttune: by a circle of the stars druid

item.name: Astralaria (Exalted)
entries: This silver-bladed axe glimmers softly with moonlight. When looking at the reflection on the blade you can see the night sky.

'Sunsmith Ouissal dreamed she gifted an exquisite axe to a woman with skin like the star-kissed sky above the Astralarium. She woke and ran to her workbench, a delighted laugh lingering in her memory.'
'Lead through actions, not words!' is inscribed on the silver blade.
You can use Astralaria as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
You can use Astralaria as a star map while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While Astralaria is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 radiant damage.
• When you make a ranged spell attack roll against a creature, you can target one additional creature within range and make a second attack roll against it.
{@bold Awakened.} When Astralaria reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra radiant damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6.
• When you use your cosmic omen feature, you can expend a spell slot of any level to forgo rolling the die and instead take the highest possible result.
{@bold Exalted.} When Astralaria reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +3.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +3.
• The extra radiant damage dealt by the weapon increases to 3d6.

• You can maintain concentration on two spells. When making a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, you roll with disadvantage, losing concentration on both spells when failing the saving throw.
{@bold Mastery: Vex.} If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.
item.reqAttune: by a circle of the stars druid

item.name: Amulet of Gentle Repose
entries: This copper inlaid bone Amulet seems to weakly radiate divine energy, protecting its wearer from the ravages of time.
While wearing the Amulet, a creature is under the effect of the {@spell Gentle Repose} spell.

item.name: Light of Deldrimor
entries: The Light of Deldrimor is a legendary torch, said to have been forged by the Great Dwarf himself, when he forged the Dwarfs in Anvil Rock, to guide their way through the dark caves of the Shiverpeak Mountains.
The torch glows in a warm teal light.
As and action, a character holding the torch can ignite an object not being worn or carried within 5-feet of the wielder, transferring some of the warding magic.
Any creature friendly to the wielder within 10-feet of the Light of Deldrimor or any flame lit by it does not take damage from environmental cold effects.
While wielding the torch the following spells can be cast from it (fires ignited this way do not have the warding properties granted by the torch):
Cantrips (at will): {@spell Fire Bolt|PHB}, {@spell Control Flames|XGE}, {@spell Create Bonfire|XGE}, {@spell Produce Flame|PHB}

1st Level (1/day each): {@spell Burning Hands|PHB}, {@spell Chromatic Orb|PHB} (Fire), {@spell Faerie Fire|PHB}, {@spell Fire Storm (Guild Wars)|GW}, {@spell Flare|GW}, {@spell Hellish Rebuke|PHB}, {@spell Mind Burn|GW}
2nd Level (1/day each): {@spell Aganazzar's Scorcher|XGE}, {@spell Continual Flame|PHB}, {@spell Inferno|GW}, {@spell Fireball (Guild Wars)|GW}
3rd Level (1/day each): {@spell Dispel Magic|PHB}, {@spell Fireball|PHB}, {@spell Immolate|GW}
4th Level (2/day): {@spell Conjure Minor Elementals|PHB} ({@creature Azer|MM}), {@spell Fire Shield|PHB} (Warm), {@spell Phoenix|GW}
5th Level (1/day): {@spell Meteor Shower|GW}

item.name: Minaar's Explosive
entries: As an action, a character can throw a grenade at a point up to 60 feet away.

Each creature within a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
These grapefruit-sized bombs are the signature explosive used by Minaar Stonesledge, explosive expert of the Deldrimor dwarfs.

item.name: Minaar's Upgraded Explosive
entries: As an action, a character can throw a grenade at a point up to 60 feet away.

Each creature within a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) thunder damage and 18 (4d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Enhanced by the infernal magics of the flame legion, Minaar's Explosive have reached a new level of destructive capability.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Akemi the Medic casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Akemi the Medic makes two attacks, using Mace or Radiant Flame in any combination.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) Radiant damage.

action.name: Radiant Flame
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 8}, range 60 ft. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) Radiant damage.
Loot:
1 Enspelled Staff (Level 1) (Remove Hex, with 6 charges, reduced by 1 for each time she casts it.)  (Unidentified)
If resurrect was not cast:
1 Ruby worth 325 GP and 1 Opal worth 355 GP.

bonus.name: Divine Aid (5/Day)
entries: Akemi the Medic casts {@spell banish|GW}, {@spell Healing Breeze|GW}, {@spell Healing Whisper|GW}, {@spell Holy Strike|GW}, {@spell Heal Other|GW} or {@spell healing touch|GW} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the akemi the medic fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the akemi the medic to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the akemi the medic drops to 1 hit point instead.

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Akemi the Medic casts {@spell Healing Hands|GW} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Azume the Musician casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks.)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Azume the Musician makes three Rapier.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Beguiling Song
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 16}, each creature in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} 20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the end of the performer's next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.
Loot:
1 Potion of Healing

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Azume the Musician casts {@spell Illusionary Weaponry|GW} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Captain Manzo makes three attacks, using Rapier or Light Crossbow in any combination.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Piercing damage, and the pirate has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes before the end of this turn.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 7}, range 30/90 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Piercing damage.

bonus.name: {@spell Banishing Smite} {@recharge 4}
entries: The target hit by the attack roll takes an extra {@damage 5d10} Force damage from the attack. If the attack reduces the target to 50 Hit Points or fewer, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be transported to a harmless demiplane for the duration. While there, the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: {@actTrigger} Captain Manzo is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. {@actResponse} Captain Manzo adds 3 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss. On a miss, Captain Manzo makes one Rapier attack against the triggering creature if within range.
Loot:
1 Potion of Gaseous Form (Unidentified)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the captain manzo fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the captain manzo to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the captain manzo drops to 1 hit point instead.

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Captain Manzo casts {@spell Flourish|GW} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Captain Manzo casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks.)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: First Mate Sakai makes two attacks, using Shortsword or Longbow in any combination.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Piercing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Piercing damage if the attack was made with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 7}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) Piercing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Piercing damage if the attack was made with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

bonus.name: Aim
entries: First Mate Sakai has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes during the current turn.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: {@actTrigger} First Mate Sakai is hit by an attack roll. {@actResponse} First Mate Sakai halves the damage (round down) it takes from that attack.
Loot:
1 Moon-Touched Greatsword (Unidentified)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the first mate sakai fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: First Mate Sakai casts {@spell Spike Trap|GW} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Operate Cannon
entries: First Mate Sakai either takes the utilize action to load or aim the cannon, or the Cannonball action to fire it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: First Mate Sakai casts one of the following spells, using Dexterity as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks.)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):
footerEntries: *Nai the Cook casts these spells on himself before combat.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mage makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Lightning Burst
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) Lightning damage.
Loot:
1 Potion of Climbing (Unidentified)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the nai the cook fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the nai the cook to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the nai the cook drops to 1 hit point instead.

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Nai the Cook casts {@spell Glimmering Mark|GW} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

bonus.name: Misty Step (3/Day)
entries: The mage casts {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

reaction.name: Protective Magic (3/Day)
entries: The mage casts {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} or {@spell Shield|XPHB} in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Oswald casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

trait.name: Stench
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 13}, any creature that starts its turn in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from Oswald. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} The target is immune to Oswald's Stench for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Oswald makes two Horrific Necrosis attacks. It can replace one attack with a Claw attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) Slashing damage. If the target isn't an Undead, it has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Horrific Necrosis
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Necrotic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.
Loot:
1 Periapt of Wound Closure (Unidentified)

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Oswald casts {@spell Wither|GW} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

trait.name: One with the Woods
entries: While the hag remains motionless in forest terrain, she is indistinguishable from an old, decomposing log or tree stump.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wood hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The wood hag can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Woodland Walk
entries: Difficult terrain composed of plants doesn't cost the wood hag extra movement. In addition, she can pass through plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wood hag makes two Claw or Toxic Splinter attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Toxic Splinter
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is {@condition paralyzed}. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature within 5 feet of the target can take its action to remove the splinter with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on the target.

bonus.name: Nettling Word
entries: The wood hag heckles, mocks, or jeers at one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the creature can hear and understand the hag, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw or become enraged until the end of its next turn. While enraged, a creature has advantage on melee attack rolls, is unable to distinguish friend from foe, and must move to and attack the nearest creature other than the hag. If no other creature is near enough to move to and attack, the enraged creature stalks off in a random direction. Attack rolls against an enraged creature have advantage.

1 Lock of Trickery (Unidentified)

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Arboria Woodcurse casts {@spell Fevered Dreams|GW} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Summon Undead (1/Day)
entries: The necromancer magically summons five {@creature skeleton||skeletons} or {@creature zombie||zombies}. The summoned creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the necromancer, whom they obey. They take their turns immediately after the necromancer. Each lasts for 1 hour, until it or the necromancer dies, or until the necromancer dismisses it as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
entries: When the necromancer kills a creature with necrotic damage, the necromancer regains 9 ({@damage 2d8}) hit points.

While the war between the White Mantle and the Shining Blade tears apart her Krytan homeland, Livia risks everything to keep her people safe. She joined the Shining Blade to protect them; she killed to defend them. Now freed from the control of the deadly Mursaat, Kryta struggles to survive, its leaders destroyed and its population beset by civil disorder.

Tasked by her superiors with finding a way to end the civil war, Livia has traveled into the Depths. She seeks a weapon of power—anything that will keep Kryta safe. And she is willing to give her life for it... as well as the lives of those around her.

trait.name: Amphibious

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Rend

action.name: Shard Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 14}, each creature in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 49 ({@damage 14d6}) Piercing damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

Bone Dragons are found throughout the Kryta region in the Prophecies campaign. Bone Dragons as we see them are only half of their original bodies, the lower half having torn off due to the pure strength of the Bone Dragons' forearms when they were risen from their graves.

legendary.name: Pounce

Rotscale is a mighty reanimated dragon from the Shiverpeak Mountains, near the Frost Gate and recently made a trek to Kryta, where many adventurers attempted to slay it. Eventually, Rotscale reached the border of the Maguuma Jungle, in Majesty's Rest, where it currently resides with its small but powerful undead army, including several Rotting Dragons. Rumors claim that Rotscale guards treasure, supposedly a weapon of value.

headerEntries: Lord Khobay is a 15th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). Lord Khobay has the following Wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *Lord Khobay casts these spells on himself before combat.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: {@bold Concentration.} You have Advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

{@bold Reactive Spell.} When a creature provokes an Opportunity Attack from you by leaving your reach, you can take a Reaction to cast a spell at the creature rather than making an Opportunity Attack. The spell must have a casting time of one action and must target only that creature.
{@bold Somatic Components.} You can perform the Somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a Shield in one or both hands.

bonus.name: Bladesong
entries: The Bladesong lasts for 1 minute and ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, if you don armor or a Shield, or if you use two hands to make an attack with a weapon. You can dismiss the Bladesong at any time (no action required). While the Bladesong is active, you gain the following benefits.
{@bold Agility.} You gain a bonus to your AC equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1), and your Speed increases by 10 feet.
{@bold Bladework.} Whenever you attack with a weapon with which you have proficiency, you can use your Intelligence modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity.
{@bold Focus.} When you make a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the total.

entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 1 hour or until it takes damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

Until the end of the target's next turn, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved; the target can't take Reactions; and it can take either an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn, not both. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 5: Enervation Ray
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Poison damage, and the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, the target can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 6: Telekinetic Ray
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 17} (the target succeeds automatically if it is Gargantuan). {@actSaveFail} Lazarus the Dire moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction. The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the start of Lazarus the Dire's next turn or until Lazarus the Dire has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. Lazarus the Dire can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a tool or opening a door or container.

items.name: 7: Sleep Ray
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 17} (the target succeeds automatically if it is a Construct or an Undead). {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The condition ends if the target takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

items.name: 8: Petrification Ray

items.name: 9: Disintegration Ray
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} 36 ({@damage 8d8}) Force damage. If the target is a nonmagical object or a creation of magical force, a 10-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of it disintegrates into dust. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it disintegrates into dust.

items.name: 10: Death Ray
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} 55 ({@damage 10d10}) Necrotic damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

- Speed reduced by 90%.
- Can either take an action or bonus action, not both.
- Can't take reactions.
- Can only make one attack per turn.

For example, the {@creature Panther|XMM} stat block can also represent a mountain lion, while the {@creature Giant Goat|XMM} stat block might represent a buffalo. Any of these stat blocks might also serve as fantastical animals with distinctive names and cosmetic details unique to your D&D adventures.

Inhabitants of the rain forest answer a druid's summons

trait.name: Flyby

entries.name: Gargoyle
entries: {@i Sculpted Sentinel Hidden in Plain Sight}

Gargoyles are sculptures inhabited by elemental spirits. Wings and magic allow their heavy stone bodies to fly, and they often perch where they can blend in amid ornate architecture, rock formations, or mundane statues. Gargoyles usually serve the magic-users who conjured them into their bodies, but if left to their own devices, they might play cruel pranks and steal treasures to hoard in lofty lairs.
Gargoyles have a variety of appearances. Roll on or choose a result from the Gargoyle Sculptures table to inspire how a gargoyle looks.

entries.caption: Gargoyle Sculptures
colLabels: The Gargoyle Is Sculpted to Appear...
rows: Damaged or marred by mismatched pieces.
Gothically fiendish with horns and a tail.
Useful, like an ornate podium or a pillar.

entries.name: Gargoyle Ambushes
entries: Gargoyles seek to ambush foes or creatures that trespass on their territories. With no biological needs and supernatural patience, these monsters might wait unmoving for months, revealing themselves only when conditions are perfect to attack. They tend to lurk where statuary seems commonplace or where terrain obscures the shape and color of their bodies. Roll on or choose a result from the Gargoyle Camouflage table to inspire where a gargoyle sets up an ambush.

entries.caption: Gargoyle Camouflage
rows: Burls and bark on a giant tree.
Monuments in a graveyard or memorial.
Outcroppings on a cliff or rock formation
The {@condition petrified} victims of a basilisk or medusa.
Reliefs on a sculpted gate or wall.
Rubble in a ruin or junkyard.
Stalactites or icicles on a cavern ceiling.
Statuary on a castle, mansion, or temple.

entries: Where evil passes in the Elemental Plane of Earth, it stains the rock and spoils the soil. Malice vanishes amid other elements, but in the dismal dark, the wicked shape it into nightmares.
entries.by: Tiv, Scholar of the Elemental Planes

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it makes a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 5} plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. On a successful save, the zombie drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage.

Humanoid zombies usually serve as guardians, servants, or soldiers for evil magic-users. In rare cases, foul magic might result in widespread reanimation of the dead, unleashing hordes of zombies to terrorize the living.

entries.name: Zombies
entries: {@i Relentless Reanimated Corpses}

Zombies are unthinking, reanimated corpses, often gruesomely marred by decay and lethal traumas. They serve whatever supernatural force animates them—typically evil necromancers or fiendish spirits. Zombies are relentless, merciless, and resilient, and their dead flesh can carry on even after suffering grievous wounds. While they can follow simple orders, they rely on primal drives rather than thought. They fulfill commands by working tirelessly or battering through foes, but they are easily stymied by barriers or unexpected circumstances.

Zombies are usually created from Humanoid corpses, but the remains of other creatures can also become zombies. Such monstrous zombies might possess the strength they had in life or a measure of their supernatural abilities, but they employ such abilities haphazardly at best.

Then, by a spectacular crack of lightning, the figures came into view, moving slowly toward the village. Over driving winds a voice cried out, "The dead come for Marais d'Tarascon! An army of the walking dead!"
entries.by: Account of the Night of the Walking Dead

Skeletons are reanimated Humanoid bones bearing the equipment they had in life. They have rudimentary faculties and greater agility than zombies and similar shambling corpses. While they aren't capable of creating plans of their own, they avoid obvious barriers and self-destructive situations.

entries.name: Skeletons
entries: {@i Ossified Evil}

Skeletons rise at the summons of necromancers and foul spirits. Whether they're the remains of the ancient dead or fresh bones bound to morbid ambitions, they commit deathless work for whatever forces reanimated them, often serving as guardians, soldiers, or laborers. In rare cases, skeletons are reanimated but given no particular direction. Roll on or choose a result from the Skeleton Pantomimes table to inspire how undirected skeletons behave.

entries.caption: Skeleton Pantomimes
colLabels: Left to Its Own Devices, the Skeleton...
rows: Delivers meal salvers or ages-old correspondence to the crypt of its dead master.
Endlessly trains in battle with other skeletons, despite being hacked to animate splinters.
Mimics ways it entertained itself in life, such as acting, dancing, or reading.
Performs a familiar task, such as cleaning, cooking, mining, or praying.
Repeats its final moments of life.
Stands guard at the post it protected in life.

images.title: Adventurers face an onslaught from all manner of skeletons

bonus.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, the shadow takes the Hide action.

entries.name: Shadow
entries: {@i Disembodied, Life-Drinking Shade}
Shadows are incorporeal Undead that feed on life. They resent the living for possessing the potential and vitality lost to them.

Shadows lurk in dark, lonely places, typically sites that were meaningful to them in life or cursed places with ties to death, sinister magic, or the Shadowfell. Their victims rise as new shadows and prey on the living.
Shadows might resemble the silhouettes of who they were in life or take on more menacing forms. Roll on or choose a result from the Shadow Shapes table to inspire a shadow's form and haunting.

entries.caption: Shadow Shapes
rows: A distorted stalker that lurks in the woods.
A fiend that dwells near a wicked ritual site.
Grasping hands that haunt a miser's home.
A grim storybook character that follows those who speak its name.
Its target, acting in eerie pantomime.
An ominous priest that haunts a defiled site.
