Skeletons rise at the summons of necromancers and foul spirits. Whether they're the remains of the ancient dead or fresh bones bound to morbid ambitions, they commit deathless work for whatever forces reanimated them, often serving as guardians, soldiers, or laborers. In rare cases, skeletons are reanimated but given no particular direction. Roll on or choose a result from the Skeleton Pantomimes table to inspire how undirected skeletons behave.

entries.caption: Skeleton Pantomimes
colLabels: Left to Its Own Devices, the Skeleton...
rows: Delivers meal salvers or ages-old correspondence to the crypt of its dead master.
Endlessly trains in battle with other skeletons, despite being hacked to animate splinters.
Mimics ways it entertained itself in life, such as acting, dancing, or reading.
Performs a familiar task, such as cleaning, cooking, mining, or praying.
Repeats its final moments of life.
Stands guard at the post it protected in life.

images.title: Adventurers face an onslaught from all manner of skeletons

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Skullreaver is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). Skullreaver has the following Elementalist (GW) spells prepared:

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 2}, reach 5 ft. {@h}1 Piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Poison damage.

entries.name: Animals
entries: Use these stat blocks to represent the creatures they're named for or other similar creatures. For example, the {@creature Panther|XMM} stat block can also represent a mountain lion, while the {@creature Giant Goat|XMM} stat block might represent a buffalo. Any of these stat blocks might also serve as fantastical animals with distinctive names and cosmetic details unique to your D&D adventures.

images.title: A druid calls on animals of the hills and mountains to aid her cause
Aquatic animals swim alongside a druid exploring the sea
Inhabitants of the rain forest answer a druid's summons

trait.name: Death Burst (Diseased Devourer)
entries: When the diseased devourer dies, it explodes in a cloud of {@condition disease|GW}. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save and getting {@condition disease|GW|diseased} for 1 minute, taking {@damage 1d4} damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Detect Life
entries: The banshee magically senses the direction of creatures up to 1 mile away that aren't Constructs or Undead.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The banshee makes two Corrupting Touch attacks and uses Horrify or Spellcasting.

action.name: Corrupting Touch
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Horrify
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 13}, one creature the banshee can see within 60 feet that can see the banshee. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the start of the banshee's next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} The target is immune to this banshee's Horrify for 24 hours.

action.name: Deathly Wail {@recharge}
entries: The banshee releases a mournful wail if it isn't in sunlight. {@actSave con} {@dc 13}, each creature within 30 feet that can hear the wail and isn't a Construct or an Undead. {@actSaveFail} If the target has 25 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or fewer, it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Otherwise, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Banshee
entries: {@i Wailing Harbinger of Death}

Heralds of doom and plagues on the living, banshees are spirits obsessed by unresolved bitterness or sorrow. These storied phantoms slay any who glimpse them or hear their baleful wails. Although any tormented soul can arise as a banshee, some elven communities particularly fear them and believe that those who hoard or destroy beauty—natural or otherwise—risk returning as a banshee.
All manner of torments might give rise to a banshee. Roll on or choose a result from the Banshee Sorrows table to inspire how a banshee's torment influences its behavior.

entries.caption: Banshee Sorrows
rows: Appear prior to a family member's death.
Haunt the site where it was executed.
Lament a lost love and haunt their grave.
Seek the return of a stolen treasure.
Slay those more beautiful than it was in life.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Screamheart is a 6th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). Screamheart has the following Mesmer (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Demonic Restoration
entries: If the demon dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} somewhere in the Abyss.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The demon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While in {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB}, the demon has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and attack rolls.

action.name: Umbral Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) Psychic damage.

bonus.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, the demon takes the Hide action.

entries.name: Shadow Demon
entries: {@i Vestige of Evil}

Shadow demons form when exceptionally wicked demons are destroyed and prevented from reconstituting their physical forms in the Abyss. This might occur due to divine intervention, when a demon is destroyed in the Abyss, or under more unusual circumstances. Shadow demons are the incorporeal remnants of these destroyed demons' evil. They usually vaguely resemble their former shapes, but some take purposefully deceptive shapes. Many lurk in dark places or venture out only at night to hide their true forms from those they manipulate.

Shadow demons seek ways to regain their former might and take revenge on those who destroyed them. They often ingratiate themselves with more powerful demons or mortal spellcasters, bargaining with and coercing others into restoring them to power. Many try to claim or corrupt souls to restore their fiendish forms, while some shadow demons seek wicked relics or nexuses of profane magic. It typically takes shadow demons centuries to recover their demonic power, if they ever do.

Particularly powerful demons might return as multiple shadow demons after being defeated. These fiendish entities each think they're the true manifestation of their past self and hunt one another to recover their power.
In rare cases, Fiends other than demons might adopt forms similar to shadow demons.
There are three rules to endings. First, good always wins. Second, evil always returns. Third, the first rule isn't always true.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Tomb Nightmare is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Tomb Nightmare has the following Necromancer (GW) spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The armor makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

Animated suits of armor might move with steady deliberateness or awkward gaits. They're often constructed from plate armor, making them easy to mistake for soldiers or helmed horrors. Other types of armor or even metal statuary might also become animated armor.

entries.name: Animated Objects
entries: {@i Mundane Objects Come to Life}

Magic can manipulate mundane items, compelling them to perform simple tasks. Such animate objects might be unassuming tools or decorations that can defend their creator. These objects follow simple instructions from whatever force or magic-user created them. If left unattended, they might defend an area for ages or repeat a task until they wear out.
Roll on or choose a result from the Animated Object Catalysts table to inspire what sort of magic motivates an ambulatory item.
Lyin' next to the chest were the bones of Cap'n Scornblade himself, still clutchin' his rusty sword. Imagine my surprise when the blade flew from his bony grasp! Still got the scar.

entries.caption: Animated Object Catalysts
rows: A Celestial or Fiend using the object to protect or torment a mortal.
A combination of magic and technology, such as alchemy or alien science.
The essence of someone transformed by a supernatural trickster.
Fey as part of their games or wiles.
Happenstance, with the item gaining a semblance of life after a hundred years of use.
A magic-user in need of a guardian or servant.
The song of a magical instrument.
Wild magic, a spell that went awry, or a chaotic Artifact.
The will of a powerful psychic being.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Restless Armor is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Strength (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Restless Armor has the following Warrior (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The poltergeist can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The poltergeist makes one Object Slam attack and uses Telekinetic Thrust.

action.name: Object Slam
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Telekinetic Thrust
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 12}, one creature the poltergeist can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) Force damage, and the target is pushed up to 30 feet in any horizontal direction.

bonus.name: Vanish
entries: The poltergeist gives itself the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition or ends that condition on itself.

entries.name: Poltergeist
entries: {@i Malevolent or Mischievous Spirit}

Poltergeists are spirits that confuse and torment the living. While typically not visible, they sometimes appear as faded images of whoever they were in life. Some poltergeists don't realize they're dead and go through the motions of their past lives. Others are malicious beings or embodiments of fractured psyches that sow discord where they haunt.
Poltergeists telekinetically move objects in the places they lurk. Roll on or choose a result from the Poltergeist Activities table to inspire how a poltergeist menaces the living.

entries.caption: Poltergeist Activities
colLabels: To Torment the Living, the Poltergeist...
rows: Makes noises like someone trapped in a wall.
Organizes a pack's contents across the floor.
Playfully puppets a corpse or doll.
Sticks knives or weapons in the ceiling.
Uncannily stacks books, furniture, or utensils.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Repentant Cultist is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Repentant Cultist has the following Monk (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

trait.name: Bright Light Weakness
entries: The Creeping Shadow takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in Bright Light or enters it on its turn.

entries.name: Shadow
entries: {@i Disembodied, Life-Drinking Shade}
Shadows are incorporeal Undead that feed on life. They resent the living for possessing the potential and vitality lost to them.

Shadows lurk in dark, lonely places, typically sites that were meaningful to them in life or cursed places with ties to death, sinister magic, or the Shadowfell. Their victims rise as new shadows and prey on the living.
Shadows might resemble the silhouettes of who they were in life or take on more menacing forms. Roll on or choose a result from the Shadow Shapes table to inspire a shadow's form and haunting.

entries.caption: Shadow Shapes
rows: A distorted stalker that lurks in the woods.
A fiend that dwells near a wicked ritual site.
Grasping hands that haunt a miser's home.
A grim storybook character that follows those who speak its name.
Its target, acting in eerie pantomime.
An ominous priest that haunts a defiled site.

monster.name: Rotting Dead

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Rotting Dead is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The Rotting Dead has the following Necromancer (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The Rotting Dead has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The Rotting Dead doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Rotting Dead makes two Deathly Claw or Grave Bolt attacks.

action.name: Deathly Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Grave Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) necrotic damage.

monster.name: Rotting Maw
languages: understands Deep Speech and Undercommon but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it makes a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 5} plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. On a successful save, the zombie drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie uses Eye Rays twice and uses Spellcasting.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The zombie randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll {@dice 1d4}; reroll if the zombie has already used that ray during this turn):

items.name: 1: Paralyzing Ray
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 14}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

items.name: 2: Fear Ray
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 14}. {@actSaveFail} 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

items.name: 3: Enervation Ray
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 14}. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage, and the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, the target can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 4: Disintegration Ray
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 14}. {@actSaveFail} 27 ({@damage 5d10}) Force damage. If the target is a nonmagical object or a creation of magical force, a 10-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of it disintegrates into dust. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it disintegrates into dust.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Rotting Maw is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The Rotting Maw has the following Mesmer (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The wisp can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The wisp sheds {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 20-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 20 feet.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Shock
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) Lightning damage.

bonus.name: Consume Life
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 10}, one living creature the wisp can see within 5 feet that has 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. {@actSaveFail} The target dies, and the wisp regains 10 ({@dice 3d6}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

bonus.name: Vanish
entries: The wisp and its light have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the wisp's {@status Concentration|XPHB} ends on this effect, which ends early immediately after the wisp makes an attack roll or uses Consume Life.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Swamp Light is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Swamp Light has the following Elementalist (GW) spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ape makes two Fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock {@recharge}
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 5}, range 25/50 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Animals
entries: Use these stat blocks to represent the creatures they're named for or other similar creatures. For example, the {@creature Panther|XMM} stat block can also represent a mountain lion, while the {@creature Giant Goat|XMM} stat block might represent a buffalo. Any of these stat blocks might also serve as fantastical animals with distinctive names and cosmetic details unique to your D&D adventures.

Aquatic animals swim alongside a druid exploring the sea
Inhabitants of the rain forest answer a druid's summons

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Swamp Ape is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Strength (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The Swamp Ape has the following Warrior (GW) spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ape makes two Fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Boulder Toss {@recharge}
entries: The ape hurls a boulder at a point it can see within 90 feet. {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 5-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point. {@actSaveFail} 24 ({@damage 7d6}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

bonus.name: Leap
entries: The ape jumps up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

entries.name: Animals
entries: Use these stat blocks to represent the creatures they're named for or other similar creatures. For example, the {@creature Panther|XMM} stat block can also represent a mountain lion, while the {@creature Giant Goat|XMM} stat block might represent a buffalo. Any of these stat blocks might also serve as fantastical animals with distinctive names and cosmetic details unique to your D&D adventures.

images.title: A druid calls on animals of the hills and mountains to aid her cause
Aquatic animals swim alongside a druid exploring the sea
Inhabitants of the rain forest answer a druid's summons

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Giant Swamp Ape is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Strength (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The Giant Swamp Ape has the following Warrior (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Disgorge Zombie
entries: As a bonus action, the tyrannosaurus zombie can disgorge a normal {@creature zombie}, which appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. The disgorged {@creature zombie} acts on its own initiative count. After a zombie is disgorged, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 1, the tyrannosaurus zombie runs out of zombies to disgorge and loses this trait. If the tyrannosaurus zombie still has this trait when it dies, {@dice 1d4} normal zombies erupt from its corpse at the start of its next turn. These zombies act on their own initiative count.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the tyrannosaurus zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tyrannosaurus zombie makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 4d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the tyrannosaurus zombie can't bite another target or disgorge zombies.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.
Several new zombie variants are presented below. For more information on zombies, see the Monster Manual.

entries.name: Ankylosaurus Zombie
entries: This creature is slow and barely aware of its surroundings.

entries.name: Girallon Zombie
entries: Girallons are four-armed apes with white fur. Girallon zombies are slower than their non-undead counterparts but no less fierce. The necromantic energy empowering them fuels their murderous hearts and their hunger for living flesh.

entries.name: Tyrannosaurus Zombie
entries: A tyrannosaurus zombie has a gullet full of smaller zombies, which it can disgorge. These zombies aren't under the tyrannosaurus zombie's control.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Rotting Tyrannosaurus is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Strength (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The Rotting Tyrannosaurus has the following Warrior (GW) spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast {@spell Shatter|XPHB}.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 12}, reach 10 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) Slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Lightning damage.

action.name: Lightning Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 19}, each creature in a 90-foot-long, 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 60 ({@damage 11d10}) Lightning damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

legendary.name: Cloaked Flight
entries: The dragon uses Spellcasting to cast {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} on itself, and it can fly up to half its {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB}. The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Sonic Boom
entries: The dragon uses Spellcasting to cast {@spell Shatter|XPHB}. The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe
entries: The dragon makes one Rend attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Luring Song
entries: The harpy sings a magical melody, which lasts until the harpy's {@status Concentration|XPHB} ends on it. {@actSave wis} {@dc 11}, each Humanoid and Giant in a 300-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the harpy when the song starts. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the song ends and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and ignores the Luring Song of other harpies. If the target is more than 5 feet from the harpy, the target moves on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet of the harpy. It doesn't avoid {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}; however, before moving into damaging terrain (such as lava or a pit) and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, the target repeats the save. {@actSaveSuccess} The target is immune to this harpy's Luring Song for 24 hours.

entries.name: Harpy
entries: {@i Winged Voice of Doom}

Hate-filled creatures, harpies strive to cause pain and bring an end to love and life. These monsters combine humanlike features with the talons and wings of avian scavengers. Their notorious songs compel listeners to follow them, heedless of danger. Creatures captivated by a harpy's song frequently meet their deaths on harpies' vicious claws or amid natural perils.

Harpies dwell in remote, dismal places tainted by tragedy and despair. Some tales claim harpies offended the gods and were transformed as a punishment; harpies might also be the descendants of such cursed souls.
Every harpy sings a distinct song. While some songs are said to be heartbreaking in their beauty, others are wretched squawking and compel only the magically enthralled.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Coastal Harpy is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Coastal Harpy has the following Mesmer (GW) spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scorpion makes two Claw attacks and one Sting attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 13}) from one of two claws.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/90 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) Piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Poison damage.

entries.name: Animals
entries: Use these stat blocks to represent the creatures they're named for or other similar creatures. For example, the {@creature Panther|XMM} stat block can also represent a mountain lion, while the {@creature Giant Goat|XMM} stat block might represent a buffalo. headerEntries: The Lash Devourer is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Dexterity (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Lash Devourer has the following Ranger (GW) spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scorpion makes two Claw attacks and one Sting attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 13}) from one of two claws.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) Piercing damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) Poison damage.

entries.name: Animals
entries: Use these stat blocks to represent the creatures they're named for or other similar creatures. images.title: A druid calls on animals of the hills and mountains to aid her cause

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Carrion Devourer is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Strength (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Carrion Devourer has the following Warrior (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has five heads. Whenever the hydra takes 25 damage or more on a single turn, one of its heads dies. The hydra dies if all its heads are dead. At the end of each of its turns when it has at least one living head, the hydra grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken Fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} when it grows new heads.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} that can be used only for {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many Bite attacks as it has heads, it can forgo three of these attacks to use spellcasting.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 10 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Hydra
entries: {@i Multiheaded Serpent of Legend}

Hydras are storied hero slayers with vicious, serpentine heads and infamous regenerative powers. Endlessly hungry, they devour any creatures they catch. Hydras that deplete an area of prey often go into a lengthy torpor until new prey arrives.

Most hydras have five heads, but some mature or battle-tested hydras have more. Such elder hydras might become local legends, known for their battles with heroes or for the riches lost in their domains.

While many hydras claim their own territories, wicked deities might use them to guard treasures or magical sites. Roll on or choose a result from the Hydra Lairs table to inspire why a hydra lurks where it does.

entries.caption: Hydra Lairs
colLabels: The Hydra Lurks Where It Does To...
rows: Ensure none claim the weapon of a fallen hero.
Defend the home of a wise but sinister oracle.
Guard a magical herb that blooms once a year.
Protect a font of poison that pollutes a river.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Lost Hydra is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The Lost Hydra has the following Elementalist (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Iron Scent
entries: The rust monster can pinpoint the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of itself.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rust monster makes one Bite attack and uses Antennae twice.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Antennae
entries: The rust monster targets one nonmagical metal object—armor or a weapon—worn or carried by a creature within 5 feet of itself. {@actSave dex} {@dc 11}, the creature with the object. {@actSaveFail} The object takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers (armor) or to its attack rolls (weapon). Armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10, and a weapon is destroyed if its penalty reaches -5. The penalty can be removed by casting the {@spell Mending|XPHB} spell on the armor or weapon.

action.name: Destroy Metal
entries: The rust monster touches a nonmagical metal object within 5 feet of itself that isn't being worn or carried. The touch destroys a 1-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of the object.

reaction.name: Reflexive Antennae
entries: {@actTrigger} An attack roll hits the rust monster. {@actResponse} The rust monster uses Antennae.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Rust Devourer is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Dexterity (spell save {@dc 11}, +3 to hit with spell attacks). The Rust Devourer has the following Warrior (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Feline Agility
entries: When the Charr Hunter moves on its turn in combat, it can double its speed until the end of the turn. Once it uses this ability, the tabaxi can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Charr Hunter makes two attacks with its claws, its shortsword, or its shortbow.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Charr Hunter is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Charr Hunter has the following Ranger (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The Magma Blister can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The Magma Blister can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) Acid damage.

reaction.name: Split
entries: {@actTrigger} While the Magma Blister is Large or Medium and has 10+ {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it becomes {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} or is subjected to Lightning, Slashing or Fire damage. {@actResponse} The jelly splits into two new Magma Blister. Each new Magma Blister is one size smaller than the original Magma Blister and acts on its {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}. The original Magma Blister's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} are divided evenly between the new Magma Blisters (round down).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Magma Blister is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Magma Blister has the following Elementalist (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The rat has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the rat's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 feet. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Animals
entries: Use these stat blocks to represent the creatures they're named for or other similar creatures. For example, the {@creature Panther|XMM} stat block can also represent a mountain lion, while the {@creature Giant Goat|XMM} stat block might represent a buffalo. Any of these stat blocks might also serve as fantastical animals with distinctive names and cosmetic details unique to your D&D adventures.

images.title: A druid calls on animals of the hills and mountains to aid her cause
Aquatic animals swim alongside a druid exploring the sea
Inhabitants of the rain forest answer a druid's summons

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Plague Rat is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Dexterity (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The Plague Rat has the following Necromancer (GW) spells prepared:

spell.name: Keystone Signet
entries: {@variantrule Elite|GW}, {@variantrule Signet|GW|Signet:} Short Rest
Activate the ancient Keystone Signet, recharging most of your signets and giving them extra power.
You regain all expended uses of your {@variantrule Signet|GW|Signets} that require you to finish a short rest or exit initiative, except {@spell Keystone Signet|GW}.

For the duration, when you target a hostile creature with a {@variantrule Signet|GW}, target each creature other than the target in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the target. Each new target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a new target takes {@dice 4d6} psychic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a new target takes half as much damage but suffers no other effect.
After this spell triggers {@dice 1d4 + 1} times, this spell ends.
Keystone Signet

Elite Signet. All of your signets except Keystone Signet are recharged. For 20 seconds, the next 0...5...6 time[s] you use a signet that targets a foe, all other foes adjacent to your target take 15...51...60 damage and are interrupted.

spell.name: Lightning Javelin

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range make an attack roll

entries: {@variantrule Armor Penetration|GW}
Conjure a lightning javelin in your hand and throw it in a straight line, passing through all creatures along its path to its target.
Choose one creature that you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d12} lightning damage.
This attack ignores cover provided by other creatures.

On a hit, target each creature, other than you and the target, on the line between you and the target. Each new target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a new target takes {@damage 2d12} lightning damage. On a successful save, a new target takes half as much damage.
On a miss, the target and all creatures behind the target within range are also included and must make the Dexterity saving throw.
If the creature is attacking and it failed its save, the attack roll misses.

components.m: a javelin and a piece of fleece

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage each increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.
Lightning Javelin

Spell. Send out a Lightning Javelin that strikes for 15...43...50 lightning damage if it hits. Lightning Javelin interrupts attacking foes. This spell has 25% armor penetration and strikes all foes between you and your target.

spell.name: Rodgort's Invocation
entries: Invoke the hellish flames of Rodgort.

Choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 20d6} fire damage and starts {@condition burning|GW} for the duration, taking {@damage 4d6} damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage, but suffers no other effect.
At the end of each of its turns, a target can make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.

components.m: the scale of a red dragon

entries: Rodgort's Invocation
Spell. Target foe and all nearby foes are struck for 15...99...120 fire damage and set on fire for 1...3...3 second[s].

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage each increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Symbol of Wrath/Kirin's Wrath
entries: Sear a holy symbol of wrath on the surrounding ground, smiting all hostile creatures around you.

Conjure a 10-foot radius, 10-foot high stationary Cylinder at your location for the duration. Each creature, other than you, in that Cylinder must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage. A creature also makes this save if it enters the Cylinder or ends its turn there, or if the Cylinder moves into its space. A creature makes this save only once per turn.
On your later turns, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to teleport the Cylinder to your location.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.
Symbol of Wrath
Spell. For 5 seconds, foes adjacent to the location in which the spell was cast take 8...27...32 holy damage each second.
Kirin's Wrath
Spell. For 5 seconds, foes adjacent to the location in which the spell was cast take 8...27...32 holy damage each second.

spell.name: Animate Bone Horror
entries: {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Exploit a nearby corpse to create a {@creature Bone Horror|GW}.

Choose one dead creature, which has not been dead for more than 5 minutes and which has not been exploited by a spell, that you can see within range. Exploit that target, and the target becomes a {@creature Bone Horror|GW}.
The {@creature Bone Horror|GW} remains for the duration or until it reaches zero hit points, at which point it will disintegrate into ash.

The {@creature Bone Horror|GW} is friendly to you and your allies for the duration. If you fall {@condition unconscious}, the {@creature Bone Horror|GW} becomes hostile towards everything instead of disintegrating into ash. The {@creature Bone Horror|GW} acts on your initiative but takes its turn directly after yours. The {@creature Bone Horror|GW} is in the DM's control.
On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to animate another {@creature Bone Horror|GW} this way.

components.m: pages of an old book

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, the duration increases to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration increases to 24 hours.
Animate Bone Horror
Spell. Exploit nearest corpse to animate a level 1...14...17 bone horror.

spell.name: Blood Reneawl
entries: {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}, {@variantrule Sacrifice|GW|Sacrifice:} 15%
Use some of your own blood in a ritual of renewal.
For the duration, at the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
When this spell ends, you regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + spellcasting ability modifier.

components.m: a pinte of blood, a needle and a bag

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases each by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.
Blood Renewal
Enchantment Spell. For 7 seconds, you gain +3...5...6 Health regeneration. When Blood Renewal ends, you gain 40...160...190 Health.

spell.name: Soul Barbs
entries: {@variantrule Hex|GW}
Curse a target to suffer each time they are targeted by another spell.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, for the duration, if the target is the target of a {@status Concentration|XPHB} spell, the target takes {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage. On a successful save, the target is affected for 1 round only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.
Soul Barbs
Hex Spell. For 30 seconds, target foe takes 15...27...30 damage when an enchantment or hex is cast on that target.

spell.name: Vampiric Touch/Vampiric Bite
entries: Siphon the life energy of the creature you touch.

Choose one creature within range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.
Vampiric Touch
Skill. Touch target foe to steal up to 29...65...74 Health.
Vampiric Bite
Skill. Touch target foe to steal up to 29...65...74 Health.

spell.name: Lava Font
entries: Create fissures around you, which spew out lava, melting everything within range.

Conjure a 10-foot radius, 10-foot high stationary Cylinder at your location for the duration. Each creature, other than you, in that Cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage. A creature also makes this save if it enters the Cylinder or ends its turn there, or if the Cylinder moves into its space. A creature makes this save only once per turn.
On your later turns, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to teleport the Cylinder to your location.
{@variantrule Overcast|GW|Overcast:} The radius of the spell increases by 5 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.
Lava Font

Spell. For 5 seconds, foes adjacent to the location where this spell was cast are struck for 5...41...50 fire damage each second. If you are Overcast, this spell strikes nearby foes instead of adjacent ones.

spell.name: Shatter Delusions
entries: Shatter a harmful spell on a creature to deal damage to everyone around it.

Choose one hostile creature that you can see within range. The latest harmful spell of 1st level or higher on the target ends. If a harmful spell was ended this way, target each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on the target. A target takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage.
Shatter Delusions
Spell. Remove one Mesmer hex from target foe. If a hex was removed, that foe and all adjacent foes takes 15...63...75 damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ignite Arrows
entries: {@variantrule Preparation|GW}
Tip your arrows with explosives.
For the duration, your ranged weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage to all creatures in a 10-foot radius around the attack target.
Ignite Arrows
Preparation. For 24 seconds, your arrows explode on contact, dealing 3...15...18 fire damage to target and all adjacent foes.

components.m: glue and bat guano

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Point Blank Shot/Zojun's Shot

time.condition: which you take immediately before hitting a target with a Ranged weapon within an eigth of the range increments of the weapon

entries: {@variantrule Weapon Attack Spell|GW}
You shoot an enemy point-blank.
You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and takes {@damage 1d8} damage.

At 5th level, the ranged attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage to the target on a hit ({@dice 2d8}). This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 11th level ({@dice 3d8}) and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).
Point Blank Shot
Bow Attack. Shoot an arrow that has half the normal range, but strikes for +10...34...40 damage.
Zojun's Shot
Bow Attack. Shoot an arrow that has half the normal range, but strikes for +10...34...40 damage.

spell.name: Wary Stance

time.condition: which you take when you are the target of a spell which requires a melee attack roll

entries: {@variantrule Stance|GW}
You enter a stance, to block any incoming melee spell.

For the duration, if you are the target of a spell which requires a melee attack roll, the attack roll misses you, your initiative gets increased by {@dice 1d4} and you gain {@dice 1d4} strikes of adrenalin.
Wary Stance
Stance. For 1...5...6 second[s], you block any attack skills used against you. For each successful block, you gain adrenaline and 5 Energy. Wary Stance ends if you use a skill.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the adrenaline gain increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st and the increase in initiative increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Predator's Pounce
entries: {@variantrule Companion|GW}
Command your companion to attempt a Predator's Pounce.

Choose one companion that can hear you within range. The companion uses its reaction to make an attack against a creature of your choice that the companion can see within the companion's range. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects and takes {@damage 2d10} damage, and the beast regains hit points equal to {@dice 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Predator's Pounce
Pet Attack. Your animal companion attempts a Predator's Pounce that deals +5...29...35 damage. If that attack hits, your animal companion gains 5...41...50 Health.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of attacks increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Restore Life
entries: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. The target returns to life with 40% of their maximum hit points. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.
Restore Life
Spell. Touch the body of a fallen party member. Target party member is returned to life with 20...56...65% Health and 42...80...90% Energy.

components.m: gems worth 300 gp, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the % increases by 10%  for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Insidious Parasite
entries: {@variantrule Hex|GW}
You magically implant a life-sucking parasite.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save for the duration when the target succeeds on an attack roll, the target takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt. On a successful save, the target is affected for 1 round only.
Insidious Parasite
Hex Spell. For 5...13...15 seconds, whenever target foe hits with an attack, you steal up to 15...39...45 Health from that foe.

components.m: a phial of swamp water

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Physical Resistance
entries: {@variantrule Stance|GW}
Enhance your physical defense at the cost of becoming vulnerable to elemental damage.
For the duration, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage, but have vulnerability to acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, and thunder damage.
Physical Resistance
Stance. For 30...78...90 seconds, You gain +40 armor against physical damage, but you lose 24...14...12 armor against elemental damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Heal Area/Karei's Healing Circle
entries: Heal every creature in an area around you.
Target each creature within a 10-foot Emanation. A target regains hit points equal to {@dice 4d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Heal Area
Spell. Heal yourself and all adjacent creatures for 30...150...180 points.
Karei's Healing Circle
Spell. Heal yourself and all adjacent creatures for 30...150...180 points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Chaos Storm
entries: Conjure a storm of chaotic energy, harming and draining the energy from an area for multiple rounds.

Choose a point that you can see within range. For the duration, you create a 10-foot Cube centered on that point. Each creature in that Cube must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 2d8} damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage. Choose one of the d8s. The number rolled on that die determines the spell's damage type, as shown below.
If you roll the same number on two or more d8s, a target's initiative gets reduced by the number.
A creature also makes this save if it enters the Cube or ends its turn there, or if the Cube moves into its space. A creature makes this save only once per turn.
On your later turns, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to teleport the Cube up to 30 feet.
Chaos Storm
Spell. Create a Chaos Storm at target foe's location that lasts for 10 seconds. Each second, foes adjacent to this location take 5...21...25 damage and lose 0...2...2 Energy.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Distortion
entries: {@variantrule Stance|GW}
You magically distort space around you, making attacks miss you.
For the duration, you have a +5 bonus to AC. If an attack misses you because of this bonus, your initiative gets reduced by {@dice 2d4} or this spell ends.
Initiative cannot be reduced below 0 with this spell.
Distortion
Stance. For 1...4...5 second[s], you have a 75% chance to block attacks. Whenever you block an attack this way, you lose 2 Energy or Distortion ends.

spell.name: Fear Me!
entries: {@variantrule Adrenaline|GW|Adrenaline:} 4
Intimidate nearby creatures to give you an opportunity to slip past their defenses, reducing their initiative and increasing your chance to critically hit them.

Target each creature other than you that can hear you within range. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target's initiative gets reduced by {@dice 1d8}, and the number you need to roll to score a critical hit against a target gets reduced by {@dice 1d4} for the duration. On a successful save, the target is affected for 1 round only.
At the end of each of its turns, a target can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the reduction of initiative increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.
"Fear Me!"
Shout. All nearby foes lose 1...3...4 Energy. For 1...12...15 second[s], your melee attacks gain +5...25...30% chance of a critical hit against stationary foes.

spell.name: Eruption
entries: Cause an eruption of dust and rocks at a location of your choosing.

Choose a point that you can see within range. For the duration, you create a 15-foot-radius, 60-foot-high cylinder centered on that point. Each creature in that Cylinder must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d10} force damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and is affected for 1 round only. A creature also makes this save if it enters the Cylinder or ends its turn there, or if the Cylinder moves into its space. A creature makes this save only once per turn.
On your later turns, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to teleport the Cylinder up to 30 feet.
At the end of each of its turns, a target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.
Eruption
Spell. Cause an Eruption at target foe's location. Each second for 5 seconds, foes near this location are struck for 10...34...40 earth damage and are Blinded for 10 seconds.

components.m: a pinch of sand and a fan

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Live Vicariously
entries: {@variantrule Bond|GW}, {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Imbue a creature's strikes with holy energy, healing yourself every time that creature hits with an attack.
Choose one friendly creature that you can see within range. For the duration, when the target hits with an attack, you regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d4}.
Live Vicariously
Enchantment Spell. While you maintain this enchantment, whenever target ally hits a foe, you gain 2...14...17 Health.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Frozen Burst
entries: {@variantrule Hex|GW}
Make spikes of ice burst out from you, slowing creatures down.

Target each creature other than you within a 15-foot Emanation. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d8} cold damage, and for the duration the target's speed is reduced by 66%. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage but suffers no other effect.
Frozen Burst
Hex Spell. All nearby foes are struck for 10...70...85 cold damage and move 66% slower for 3...7...8 seconds.

components.m: a glass phial filled with freezing water

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Shadow Strike/Lifebane Strike
entries: Strike a creature with a shadowy claw, stealing life from them if they are above 50% health.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage. If the target was above 50% of their maximum hit points, the target takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the amount of that necrotic damage dealt.
Shadow Strike
Spell. Target foe takes 12...41...48 shadow damage. If that foe's Health is above 50%, you steal up to 12...41...48 Health.
Lifebane Strike
Spell. Target foe takes 12...41...48 shadow damage. If that foe's Health is above 50%, you steal up to 12...41...48 Health.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage each increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Feral Lunge
entries: {@variantrule Companion|GW}
Command your companion to attempt a Feral Lunge, {@condition bleeding|GW} attacking creatures on a hit.

Choose one companion that can hear you within range. The companion uses its reaction to make an attack against a creature of your choice that the companion can see within the companion's range. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects and takes {@damage 2d10} damage, and if the target attacked on its last turn, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target starts {@condition bleeding|GW} for the duration, taking {@damage 1d6} damage. On a successful save, the target is affected for 1 round only.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.
Feral Lunge
Pet Attack. Your animal companion attempts a Feral Lunge that deals +5...29...35 damage. If the attack strikes a foe who is attacking, that foe suffers from Bleeding for 5...21...25 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of attacks increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Magnetic Aura
entries: {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Envelop yourself in a magnetic aura, deflecting damage back to an attacker.

For the duration, if you are the target of an attack roll, the attack roll misses you, the attacker must make a Dexterity saving throw, and this spell ends. On a failed save, the attacker takes {@damage 2d10} force damage. On a successful save, the attacker takes half as much damage.
{@variantrule Overcast|GW|Overcast:} Choose any number of friendly creatures that you can see within 150 feet. A target also gains the effect of this spell.
Magnetic Aura
Enchantment Spell. For 1...4...5 second[s], you block the next attack against you and deal 10...42...50 damage to your attacker. If you are Overcast, all party members in earshot are also enchanted.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Penetrating Blow/Penetrating Chop

time.condition: which you take immediately before hitting a target with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: {@variantrule Adrenaline|GW|Adrenaline:} 5, {@variantrule Armor Penetration|GW}, {@variantrule Weapon Attack Spell|GW}
You crush past an enemy's defenses.
On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and takes {@damage 1d6} damage.
Penetrating Blow
Axe Attack. If this attack hits, you strike for +5...17...20 damage. This axe attack has 20% armor penetration.
Penetrating Chop
Axe Attack. If this attack hits, you strike for +5...17...20 damage. This axe attack has 20% armor penetration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the target also takes {@damage 1d6} damage for each slot level above 2nd on a hit.

spell.name: Dodge/Zojun's Haste
entries: {@variantrule Stance|GW}
You focus on dodging ranged attacks.
For the duration, your speed increases by 33%, and you have a +2 bonus to AC against ranged weapon attacks.
When you make an attack roll, this spell ends.
Dodge
Stance. For 5...10...11 seconds, you move 33% faster and have a 27...65...75% chance to block incoming projectiles. Dodge ends if you attack.
Zojun's Haste
Stance. For 5...10...11 seconds, you move 33% faster and have a 27...65...75% chance to block incoming projectiles. Zojun's Haste ends if you attack.

spell.name: Shield Stance
entries: {@variantrule Stance|GW}
Enter a defensive stance, protecting yourself with your shield.
For the duration, if you are wielding a shield, you have a +5 bonus to AC and when you take damage, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and subtract the number rolled from the damage.

components.m: a shield worth at least 1 sp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 2nd, and the number subtracted increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 2nd.
Shield Stance
Stance. For 1...5...6 second[s], while wielding a shield, you have a 75% chance to block incoming attacks, and damage is reduced by 2 for each rank of Strength (maximum 15 damage reduction).

spell.name: Penetrating Attack/Sundering Attack

time.condition: which you take immediately before hitting a target with a Ranged weapon

entries: {@variantrule Armor Penetration|GW}, {@variantrule Weapon Attack Spell|GW}
You fire a penetrating shot, which pierces your enemies defenses.
On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and takes {@damage 1d8} damage.
Penetrating Attack
Bow Attack. If Penetrating Attack hits, you strike for +5...21...25 damage and this attack has 10% armor penetration.
Sundering Attack
Bow Attack. If Sundering Attack hits, you strike for +5...21...25 damage and this attack has 10% armor penetration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the target also takes {@damage 1d8} damage for each slot level above 1st on a hit.

spell.name: Elemental Resistance
entries: {@variantrule Stance|GW}
Enhance your elemental defense at the cost of becoming vulnerable to physical damage.
For the duration, you have resistance to acid, cold, fire, force, lightning and thunder damage, but you have vulnerability to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.
Elemental Resistance
Stance. For 30...78...90 seconds, You gain +40 armor against elemental damage, but you lose 24...14...12 armor against physical damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Eviscerate

time.condition: which you take immediately before hitting a target with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: {@variantrule Adrenaline|GW|Adrenaline:} 8, {@variantrule Elite|GW}, {@variantrule Weapon Attack Spell|GW}
You eviscerate a creature, inflicting a {@condition deep wound|GW}.

On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, takes {@damage 5d6} damage, and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains a {@condition deep wound|GW} for the duration.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.
Eviscerate
Elite Axe Attack. If Eviscerate hits, you strike for +1...25...31 damage and inflict a Deep Wound, lowering your target's maximum Health by 20% for 5...17...20 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the target also takes {@damage 2d6} damage for each slot level above 2nd on a hit.

spell.name: Shield of Judgment
entries: {@variantrule Elite|GW}, {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Shield a creature with the shield of judgment, which knocks attackers {@condition prone} if they hit the creature.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. For the duration, when the target takes damage from an attack, target the creature that dealt the damage. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage, but suffers no other effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.
Shield of Judgment
Elite Enchantment Spell. For 8...18...20 seconds, anyone striking target ally with an attack is knocked down and suffers 5...41...50 holy damage.

spell.name: Power Block

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

entries: {@variantrule Elite|GW}
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell and lock them out of spells of the same school of magic.

Choose one creature, which is casting a spell, that you can see within range. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

If you successfully interrupt a spell this way, the target must make an Intelligence saving throw with disadvantage. On a failure, spells of the same school of magic can't be used again for the duration. If you did not successfully interrupt a spell this way, the creature makes the saving throw with advantage.
Power Block
Elite Spell. If target foe is casting a spell or chant, that skill and all skills of the same attribute are disabled for 1...10...12 seconds and that skill is interrupted.

spell.name: Meteor Shower
entries: {@variantrule Overcast|GW|Overcast:} 5
Summon a shower of meteors at a specific location every turn.

Choose a point that you can see within range. For the duration, you create a 10-foot-radius, 300-foot-high cylinder centered on that point. Each creature in that Cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 2d12} bludgeoning damage, {@damage 4d6} fire damage, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage but suffers no other effect. A creature also makes this save if it enters the Cylinder or ends its turn there, or if the Cylinder moves into its space. A creature makes this save only once per turn.
On your later turns, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to teleport the Cylinder up to 60 feet.
Meteor Shower
Spell. Create a Meteor Shower at target foe's location. For 9 seconds, foes adjacent to that location are struck for 7...91...112 fire damage and knocked down every 3 seconds.

components.m: a small rock and a sextant

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage and the fire damage increase by {@dice 1d12} and {@dice 1d6} respectively, for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Flurry
entries: {@variantrule Stance|GW}
Increase your attack speed at the cost of damage.
For the duration, you can attack one additional time when you take the attack action on your turn, and you deal 50% less damage with weapon attacks.
Flurry
Stance. For 5 seconds, your attack rate is increased by 33%, but you deal 25% less damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Skull Crack

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range cast a spell or using an ability

entries: {@variantrule Adrenaline|GW|Adrenaline:} 8, {@variantrule Elite|GW}
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of using an ability or casting a spell, and if it was a spell, you daze that creature.

Choose one creature, which is casting a spell or using an ability, that you can see within range of your weapon. Make a melee weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the ability/spell fails and has no effect.

If you successfully interrupt a spell this way, the target must make a Constitution saving throw with disadvantage. On a failure, the target is {@condition dazed|GW} for the duration. If you did not successfully interrupt a spell this way, the creature makes the saving throw with advantage.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.
Skull Crack
Elite Melee Attack. If it hits, this attack interrupts the target's current action. If that foe was casting a spell, that foe is Dazed for 10 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the target also takes {@damage 1d8} damage for each slot level above 3rd on a hit.

spell.name: Virulence
entries: {@variantrule Elite|GW}
Inflict multiple conditions on a creature already suffering from a condition.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. If the target is suffering from a harmful condition, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, for the duration, the target is {@condition Weakness|GW|weakened}, is {@condition corruption|GW|corrupted}, taking {@damage 3d8} damage, and is {@condition disease|GW|diseased}, taking {@damage 3d8} damage. On a successful save, the target is affected for 1 round only.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw for each condition affecting it. On a success, that condition ends.
Virulence
Elite Spell. If target foe was already suffering from a condition, that foe suffers from Disease, Poison, and Weakness for 3...13...15 seconds.

components.m: the bottled cough of a sick person

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Phoenix
entries: A fiery phoenix rises at your location and flies out, exploding on impact.

Choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 10d6} fire damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.

{@variantrule Overcast|GW|Overcast:} When you cast the spell, you can choose any number of creatures. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save. Additionally, if a chosen creature was in the radius of the spell, that target gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage rolled.
Phoenix

Spell. A fiery Phoenix rises at your location and flies out to your target, exploding on impact. This explosion strikes your target and nearby foes for 10...50...60 fire damage. If you are Overcast, allies in the blast radius are healed for 20...68...80 Health.

components.m: the feather of a chicken and a pinch of sanguine dusting

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Shield of Deflection
entries: {@variantrule Elite|GW}, {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Shield a creature with a spectral shield, which blocks incoming attacks and reduces the damage they take.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. For the duration, the target has a +5 bonus to AC and when the target takes damage, you can roll {@dice 2d4} and subtract the number rolled from the damage.
Shield of Deflection
Elite Enchantment Spell. For 3...9...10 seconds, target ally has a 75% chance to block attacks and gains 15...27...30 armor.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the AC bonus increases by 1 for each slot level above 4th, and the number subtracted increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Backbreaker

time.condition: which you take immediately before hitting a target with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: {@variantrule Adrenaline|GW|Adrenaline:} 9, {@variantrule Elite|GW}, {@variantrule Weapon Attack Spell|GW}
Brutally attempt to break a creature's spine, preventing them from walking.
On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, takes {@damage 3d12} damage, and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.
To stand up from {@condition prone}, the target must first succeed on a Strength saving throw or waste its movement in the attempt.
Backbreaker
Elite Hammer Attack. If Backbreaker hits, you strike for +1...16...20 damage and your target is knocked down. If you have 8 Strength or higher, this knockdown lasts 4 seconds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the target also takes {@damage 1d12} damage for each slot level above 2nd on a hit.

spell.name: Heal Other/Jamei's Gaze
entries: Heal another creature.
Choose one creature, other than yourself, that you can see within range. The target regains hit points equal to {@dice 8d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Heal Other
Spell. Heal target other ally for 35...151...180 Health.
Jamei's Gaze
Spell. Heal target other ally for 35...151...180 Health.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 4d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Healing Hands
entries: {@variantrule Elite|GW}, {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Envelop a creature in divine healing hands, healing them every time they take damage.
Choose one creature that you can see within range. For the duration when the target takes damage, the target regains hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
If the target drops to 0 hit points, this spell ends.
Healing Hands
Elite Enchantment Spell. For 10 seconds, whenever target ally takes damage, that ally is healed for 5...29...35 Health.

components.m: a pair of sterilized gloves

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Crude Swing

time.condition: which you take immediately before hitting a target with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: {@variantrule Weapon Attack Spell|GW}
Strike your target and all creatures within 5 feet of them with a wide-reaching swing.
Target each creature other than you in a 5-foot radius centered on the target. Make a melee weapon attack against each target. On a hit, a target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects.
Crude Swing
Hammer Attack. Attack all adjacent foes. Each foe you hit is struck for +1...16...20 damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, a target also takes {@damage 1d12} damage for each slot level above 1st on a hit.

spell.name: Warrior's Endurance
entries: {@variantrule Elite|GW}
Magically enhance your endurance, enabling you to act quicker.
For the duration, when you hit with a melee attack, your initiative gets increased by {@dice 1d6}.
Warrior's Endurance
Elite Skill. For 5...29...35 seconds, you gain 3 Energy each time you hit with a melee attack. Warrior's Endurance cannot raise your Energy above 10...22...25.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the increase of initiative increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Smite

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range make an attack roll

entries: Smite a creature with radiant energy, punishing them for attacking.
Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage.
If the creature is attacking and it failed its save, the target takes another {@damage 3d8} radiant damage.
On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.
Smite
Spell. This attack [sic] deals 10...46...55 Holy [sic] damage. If attacking, your target takes an additional 10...30...35 Holy [sic] damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage each increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Vital Blessing
entries: {@variantrule Bond|GW}, {@variantrule Enchantment|GW}
Bond yourself to a creature, improving their vitality.
Choose one friendly creature that you can see within range. For the duration, the target's hit point maximum and current hit points increase by 10.
Vital Blessing
Enchantment Spell. While you maintain this enchantment, target ally has +40...168...200 maximum Health.

components.m: a basket filled with fresh vegtables

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the target's hit points increase by an additional 10 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shadow of Fear
entries: {@variantrule Hex|GW}
Create a specter of fear in the mind of a group of creatures, preventing them from attacking.

Choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, regardless of a target's abilities or magic items, a target can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during their turn. On a successful save, a target is affected for 1 round only.
Shadow of Fear
